items.title: Content Moderator
items.content:
Content Moderator

Various
Anywhere in US
Company: Twitch
Part Time

Overview

Help verify the quality of sponsored content.

As a Content Moderator, you will be responsible for analyzing and reviewing videos, and text-based content and/or investigating, escalating and/or resolving issues that are reported by users or flagged by the system.

Day-to-day responsibilities may include, but are not limited to: 
  • Serve as an advocate for sponsors.
  • Verify, investigate and resolve issues regarding content that is reported for account support and/or safety; flag for action, and resolve within agreed-upon turnaround times and standards of quality
  • Respond to inquiries with high quality, speed, and accuracy
  • Understand and remain up-to-date with policies and guidelines; resolve inquires according to defined policies and procedures
  • Fulfill base productivity and quality requirements
  • In the context of this role, individuals may be exposed to potentially disturbing content, and will need a level of resilience and maturity.

    • This is  a virtual/remote role.

    Hours / Shifts

    The role requires incumbents to work 5 out of 7 days a week on an as needed bases depending on the queue, and two consecutive days off per week.  Depending on team supported, location, and business needs, hours, shifts, and rotation frequency are subject to change.  Team Leads will try to accommodate individual schedules, but guarantees cannot be made. Given the nature of our business being 24/7, 365 days a year,  incumbents will need to bring a degree of flexibility, and remain open to working different hours, including holidays and weekends.

    To apply for this job please visit the following URL: https://jobs.lever.co/twitch/aa2b06e7-6a26-4617-a5f1-924d22f31240 →

items.title: Ladder: Growth Copywriter
items.content:
Growth Copywriter

Company: Ladder
Headquarters: New York, London, Wroclaw (Poland)
https://ladder.io/
We are looking for an ambitious, experienced copywriter who has the potential and determination to become a world-class expert in writing content to help grow companies.

  • Must have a portfolio of previous work to showcase your ability, accessible online
  • At least 2 years’ experience in a copywriting role at a fast-growing company.
  • Capacity for critical thinking and employing strategy to hit business goals.
  • Expected to flex your creative muscles and take full responsibility for performance.
  • Interested in mastering all aspects of copywriting (ads, website, blogs, emails).
  • Certifications via online or in-person digital marketing courses are a plus.

Growth Copywriter Role

You’ll work directly with the strategy team to plug in remotely as a copywriter at Ladder for our clients. You will own any copywriting briefs that get assigned to you, defining the strategy and handling execution, taking advice from the team and escalating issues to the Account Director as needed. Because your work will be reviewed directly by founders and senior managers at startups and large enterprises, the work environment is demanding and fast-paced.

To support your continuing development, we have an in-depth training plan based on our blog content and online courses we have subscriptions to. Our in-house software helps make your client briefs easier to manage, and it has hundreds of growth tactics to help you generate ideas from what's worked before for similar clients. Along the way, you will be expected to communicate progress clearly and confidently to the rest of the Ladder team. You will also be involved in training and recruiting new hires.

Future Development

You will start on smaller clients initially, increasingly working on more strategic clients as you get comfortable with our process and show your ability to produce high quality work. After your first year you will be eligible for promotion to the Senior Growth Copywriter role, which comes with a pay rise and additional supervisory / training responsibilities. 18 months in, our goal is for you to be a notable rising star within the copywriting community. As well as the training program and support from the team, Ladder’s leadership team will be actively coaching you and helping you carve out your own role as the company expands.

Team Culture

You will be based remotely, but can work from our New York City, London or Wroclaw offices when desired for this role. Dress code is informal (jeans and t-shirts are fine) but professional if you're in the office, as we often have clients visiting. We encourage remote employees to visit one of our offices each quarter and will pay for your travel within reason.

We will often pay for team lunches on special occasions / dinner if we’re working late. We host regular happy hours, game nights and other team events. Our meme game is strong and we all have custom slack emojis / obscure nicknames. We have a strong culture of supporting each other with client or strategy issues, and bouncing ideas back and forth.

If you’re a hard worker and are genuinely interested in finding innovative ways to help companies grow, you’ll love it here!

Apply for this position

Email a link to your portfolio to mike@ladder.io with the subject line "Hire me as a Copywriter", and the body a 1-2 line description of why you'd be perfect for the role.

items.content:
Amplify Life is a personal challenge and coaching hub, recently available on the App Store and Google Play.
We are looking for a creative Copywriter to join our dynamic team based in a unique location on the outskirts of Horsham. With stunning countryside views, a team who are full of life and a quickly evolving brand, Amplify Life is truly an exceptional place to work.

Reporting into the CMO, you will write clear, concise and compelling copy for various mediums (such as app and web copy, ads, blog posts and newsletters) to support health and fitness coaching content. You will conduct thorough research and interviews and work with creative professionals to build marketing projects and campaigns. Your words will inform and engage our target audiences.

Our ideal candidate is a team-spirited, skilled and imaginative writer with an eye for detail. If you can grasp project requirements quickly and offer valuable insight, we’d like to meet you.

Responsibilities include:
• Writing clear, attractive copy with a distinct voice
• Working closely with UX lead to define copy for the App and the website
• Interpreting copywriting briefs to understand project requirements
• Collaborating with designers, PR and other professionals on large- and small-scale marketing projects (e.g. email campaigns and landing pages)
• Supporting our Social Media campaigns
• Conducting high-quality research and interviews
• Editing and proofreading copy as needed
• Using SEO and ASO principles to maximize copy’s reach
• Sourcing images and other content
• Supporting sponsored features copy
What we are looking for:
• Proven experience as a copywriter or related role
• Knowledge of online content strategy and creation
• Excellent writing, editing and proofreading skills
• Experience with ASO and SEO
• Strong research skills
• Creativity
• Collaborative spirit
• Excellent time-management and organizational skills
• BSc/BA in marketing, English, journalism or related field
• Familiar with Sport/Fitness/Health industry

Does this sound like you? Then please get in touch with your CV and up to three writing samples so we can get an idea of your best work. Feel free to include links to your content or portfolio in your application.

Amplify can offer a competitive salary and benefits as well as 25 days holiday (excluding bank holidays). Our offices offer a stunning and peaceful setting to work in, a fully stocked soft drinks fridge, BBQ facilities, sun terrace, table tennis table, football and badminton facilities and a woodland adventure trail.

Due to remote location access to a car is a must!

Technical Cofounder at Crumz

Washington DC, Remote · Cofounder

The timing is right for this type of geolocation play; with the right team, this concept has the potential to scale very rapidly.

Applied
Apply to Crumz
Add a message to Crumz
Apply

Job Description

CRUMZ is a smartphone application and platform that allows users to record video messages or media then geofence (contain media within a predefined area) that video to ONE or MANY specific wide area and/or close proximity locations using both GPS & BLE Beacons. The videos/media are stored on the CRUMZ cloud database and opened when physically ‘geo-triggered’ by followers of the videos author or any CRUMZ user if the video is set as Public. CRUMZ users may also create end-to-end encrypted messages that attach to the media to foment conversations. Think "Communication Safe-Zones"

Users may also "Shake" the phone to enter (AR) mode. Visual representations in the form of avatars, stickers or emojis in live camera mode represent a portal to view the same media in the CRUMZ “Home” feed. Geofences are represented visually as digital circles painted around these emojis.

The current backend architecture for the Crumz prototype runs a Java / MySQL stack. It consists of a series of REST based endpoints to support the iOS (Swift) client. The current end points are built on top of an open source Java framework.

**Contact for the technical description of the job.

This is an equity only position until the funding round is complete.

http://www.crumzapp.com/

http://crumz.biglaunch.net/geolocation-news.html

What We're Building

With companies like McDonalds using iBeacon successfully, 2017 promises to be the dawn of push-personalized marketing. Will a person download every app from every store in the mall? No, they need one app that consolidates their preferences. Crumz is that App!

Crumz is a Geolocation Media Sharing app that allows users to:
 
Create and store short video messages for their network (or set as public). Users then geofence the message by either pinning it to their current location or setting multiple locations for it to live.  Once the video is pinned and the geofence size defined, it loads when a friend crosses into the geofenced area.

Location Specific Content from People you Follow

Applications:

Marketing: User Acclimation = Trusted Message Delivery (only people/interests you follow can push messages) - Think Influencers Driving their followers to XYZ

Honey Do Reminders, Scavenger Hunts/Extra Credit Fact Hunts, Contests, Instructions and Games -confined only by the imagination.

items.content:
Sales Representative B2B – Technical Financial SaaS at FinFolio

Remote

Description:

We are looking for driven, curious, self-motivated individuals who are ready to take on national territories with a buzzy, high engagement and proven ROI system that every salesperson dreams of being behind. As a Sales Representative, you’ll be responsible for engaging and progressing hundreds of qualified leads per quarter working diligently with the sales development team to bring leads to closing.

FinFolio is a fast-growing SaaS startup that helps financial advisors better serve their clients. Known as taking the complexity out of portfolio management system, FinFolio contains to gain market share in a multi billion dollar vertical through creating beautiful software that supports the next generation advisor and her clients.

If you want to really help people, are organized, efficient, and want to work with an incredible product — we want to hear from you!

Requirements:

  • Highly organized and efficient with attention to detail and a drive to succeed
  • A storyteller with impeccable customer service skills who thrives in a high-pressure environment
  •  Instinctive ability to overcome obstacles, pivot, and face challenges head-on with confidence
  • Innate ability to integrate into an amazing team, stay focused, and boost your peers
  • Technically savvy with the ability to use a SaaS sales stack
  • A great contributor to team culture and camaraderie and sense of humor

Responsibilities:

  • Rapidly qualify and distribute hundreds of monthly inbound sales leads and route them to AE’s as well as getting them in the appropriate email tracks
  • Track our inbound web forms queue and again route the leads in a rapid manner for callback
  • Research and qualify hundreds of trade show leads as they come in and distribute them
  • Re-engaging lapsed and long-term leads as we introduce new product features with a focus on bringing them back into the funnel
  • Managing sales stages and early funnel lead nurture as well as taking the occasional sales call
  • Assisting with outbound experiments and other sales-driven activities

You must be:

  • Ambitious
  • Have an entry level understanding of financial markets
  • Confident
  • Willing to work hard to meet your goals
  • Eager to take feedback and improve
  • Have an excellent sense of humor
  • Entry-level or recent grad

Bonus points:

  • Have experience selling a SaaS product
  • Have experience working in a professional services context

Compensation:

  • Generous salary
  • Plus an attractive commission plan for large OTE
  • Quarterly bonus for hitting goal
  • Reasonable targets

Why working here is F*&!#@N awesome!

  • Get in on the ground floor of growing company with a clear vision to scale
  • Get to work remotely
  • A fun, creative, collaborative work environment with playful, hyper-motivated driven peers
  • FinFolio is committed to hiring a diverse workforce, succeed faster, and better serve our clients
  • We’re a growing team full of possibilities – we grow, you grow

Quiz:

Once you have submitted your application please take a few minutes to complete our quiz. You will not be considered for the role without having taken the quiz: https://goo.gl/forms/eqRU1Yt7IzU4RioB3

items.title: Technical Writer
items.content:
Technical Writer at AbleVets

Remote

Job Locations: US-Remote

Overview

AbleVets, LLC is a fast-growing Service Disabled Veteran Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) providing healthcare information technology services and resources to help the VA and DoD improve the lives of the people they serve. AbleVets has an opportunity for an experienced, motivated technical writer to support our customer. This position is located in our Chantilly, Virginia office or can be remote.

Essential Functions and Job Responsibilities

The technical writer’s duties will include collaborating with software developers, technical editing and writing, establishing documentation guidelines, procedures, and templates; word processing, and coordinating final production of deliverables. Deliverables may include design documents, user manuals, operations guide, release notes, strategy and policy documents, standard operating procedures, and other contract deliverables, all of which must meet customer and software industry documentation standards and requirements. The ideal candidate will also adapt to different responsibilities, including but not limited to:

  • Establishing document repository organization within MS SharePoint, including access permissions, and uploading and organizing artifacts
  • Establishing organized mechanisms to properly track development or update of documentation, client reviews and formal submission
  • Participating in client meetings and identifying required potential changes to documentation, taking minutes of the meeting and updating it on wiki
  • Providing clear, constructive, actionable recommendations to customers for all reviewed documents
  • Reviewing, editing, and preparing client documents for publication and dissemination
  • Knowledge of Confluence tool or IBM Jazz Rational tools

Qualifications

  • At least three (3) years of engineering documentation and/or technical writing experience
  • Associate degree or 2-year technical degree required in computer science, electronics engineering, or other engineering or technical discipline; four (4) years of additional relevant experience may be substituted for education
  • Experience creating software documentation and related project documentation
  • Experience developing and delivering end user training material
  • Strong proficiency with common office productivity software (e.g., MS Word, PowerPoint, etc.)
  • Knowledge of or experience with VA development processes, specifically VA PMAS/VIP
  • Knowledge of Confluence tool or IBM Jazz Rational tools
  • Experience working with a geographically dispersed team
  • Excellent problem-solving skills
  • Must have the ability to obtain and maintain a U.S. Government Public Trust security clearance which will require successful completion of a background check and fingerprinting ( Veteran Affairs PIV card holder preferred)

EEO Statement

AbleVets LLC appreciates your interest in our company as a place of employment. We are proud to be an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer and are committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, marital status, genetic information, disability, veteran status, or any other protected class. AbleVets is a VEVRAA Federal Contractor.

items.content:
The reins: an opportunity as Creative Director / Editor-in-Chief at exciting young production company

Company: Course Concierge LLC
Headquarters: Los Angeles, LA
https://courseconcierge.com/
10 July 2018

The reins: an opportunity as Creative Director / Editor-in-Chief at exciting young production company

Hi there,

My name’s Edward. I work with entrepreneur and speaker Till H. Gross, and together we run Course Concierge. We’re an online course publishing house that develops courses for NYT best-selling authors, TED speakers, social media authorities and those with something to say.

Our clients include YouTubers with 150,000,000 views, one of the most hotly-followed health experts on Instagram, and a coach to NFL athletes, NBA players and U.S. special forces.

Check us out here: http://courseconcierge.com

For the right person, this is a Dream Opportunity — and dream company.

We’re a year-and-a-half-old and growing, and looking for someone for a role that fuses Creative Director and Editor-in-Chief; someone who can oversee and orchestrate our productions – design, development, marketing, editorial and film.

Online courses, for the most part, have a lethargic reputation. Compared with today’s video games, things are still in the primitive stages; about as far evolved as Pong. But online courses’ possibilities are endless, and that’s something we’ve set to override. A book is a book. An online course is, well, anything you want it to be. There’s a promise of the internet that’s yet to be delivered, and we’d like to be its bearer.

Each production is a serious operation, and we have many going on at the same time. There’s a picture of U.S. chess champion Bobby Fischer at age 21 playing 50 games of chess simultaneously. We need someone who can match that in productions, on topics as varied as autism enterprises to cybersecurity to yoga, and each with its own multiple five-figure budget. You’d be overseeing productions at large, tasked with driving them forward with the team harmoniously.

Directing has a great reverence in film-making. We’d like someone who can help bring about the same in online education.

We’re a company that has our house in order, and we’ve structured things very deliberately. We have a system.

And our early works have been supremely effective – we know how to drive action. The below is just one week following the release of “The Weekend Woodworker”, a course we helped produce with Steve Ramsey:

https://www.instagram.com/p/BbKigoaH1VU/?taken-by=steveramsey_wwmm

One heuristic for a course for strength coaches: “I’d happily have this person train my mum & dad after taking this”. Another all-purpose: “Would I be comfortable selling this to my best friend?” (We need courses for which the answer is a resounding Yes!)

You need to have a definite interest in online learning, curriculum development and the future of education – and relish the prospect of crafting the best learning experience imaginable.

Our ideal candidate...

- Is a strong leader. You can put pressure on the team to produce courses on time and know what a great product looks like.

- Considers themselves a coach. We want someone who can get the very best out of everyone on the team – a nurturer.

- Has a philosophy of learning. Our clients often want workbooks and quizzes. But how to do them in non-boring way? We want someone for whom, pent up from all the things you think wrong with the school educational system, wants to put things right with free rein to rewrite the rules. The opportunity to shake things up excites you.

- Can be both a “maker” (rolling up your sleeves to do things) and a manager – able to switch between the two effortlessly.

- Can guide smooth handoffs between team members, and push responsibility widely throughout the team while keeping a close eye to things.

- Can hold their own with some seriously accomplished clientele. You’re ultimately culpable for the success and client experience of productions, and a client should be able to get you on the phone promptly (in the rare circumstance) they’re dissatisfied with something.

- Is willing and able to recruit other course editors, continuing to build our brilliant team as we grow.

- Is interested on all things on the horizon – AR, VR and other cutting edge technologies and how we might utilise them.

- Can work with clients to ensure they get what they want, yet knows how to say “no” when necessary.

We’re a great company to join. Here’s why…

- The company is still young (just 18 months) and you will be getting in at the ground level. This will be one of our most important positions, and crucial to making sure our next steps are the right ones.

- Despite the company being young, we’ve a combined experience of several decades in publishing and online course creation. We have an unbelievably engaged team, with world-class people in every department, from video production to design to development to copywriting and editorial.

- We’ve got our ducks in a row. We have solid processes across the company (most strongly in production) and battle-proven workflows. The foundation is already there, so it’s yours to focus on building what we have.

- Our clients are fantastic. We have the good fortune to be incredibly selective in who we work with, and a great many have a great sense of mission in what they do.

- We’re a remote company and you’ve the freedom to work from anywhere. Preferably we’re looking for someone in North America, but are open to candidates the world over. (Our current team spans 13 time zones.)

- We’re going places.

*

This isn’t to be a typical job search. We expect to spend up to six months looking to find the right person.

There’s no deadline to reply, but please get in touch if you think you could be a good fit.

Pay will be set at a competitive rate, and we’re happy to work with notice periods, transitioning to having you come on full-time when ready.

Please do not send a CV – we don’t care where, or even whether, you went to school –  but do note experience that would allow you to command the position.

For those who stand out, we will be in touch to discuss next steps.

Thank you for considering the position. I look forward to hearing from you,

Edward

Apply for this position

There’s no deadline to reply, but please get in touch if you think you could be a good fit: Edward@CourseConcierge.com. Please do not send a CV – we don’t care where, or even whether, you went to school – but do note experience that would allow you to command the position.

items.content:
Freelance Writer

Company: Well Authored
Location: New York

Job Type: Freelance

Description

Calling all content writers!

WellAuthored.com is seeking versatile, experienced writers to contribute at least eight articles every week, each between 600 and 1,200 words. Stories are assigned by editors and cover a wide range of topics for a variety of clients and businesses. Each article must include between one and four embedded links (provided to you by the editors) that are SEO-driven for the clients. There are no interviews or sourcing required for the pieces, but some light research will be necessary to ensure a conversational-but-expert voice. Rates vary depending on story length, number of embeds and writing experience, but start at $15 per 600-word story and go up from there. Pay is distributed to writers weekly and on a per-article basis.

Editors will walk you through the entire process and provide feedback on all pieces. This is a great opportunity for consistent, remote freelance work with weekly payouts!

Selected candidates will be given paid test article assignments (up to six), each of which will be due within 24 hours. Once a writer passes the trial period, he or she will be contracted for at least eight articles each week.

For more information and to apply, send your cover letter, resume, and links to website and/or three recently published clips to [email protected]

Application Instructions

Send your cover letter, resume, and links to website and/or three recently published clips.

items.title: Gannett | USA TODAY NETWORK: Assoc. Product Manager - Technical Writer
items.content:
Assoc. Product Manager - Technical Writer

Company: Gannett | USA TODAY NETWORK
Headquarters: McLean, VA
https://usatodaynetworkcareers.com/
Gannett Co., Inc. (NYSE: GCI) is an innovative, digitally focused media and marketing solutions company committed to strengthening communities across our network. With an unmatched local-to-national reach, Gannett touches the lives of more than 110 million people monthly with our Pulitzer-Prize winning content, consumer experiences and benefits, and advertiser products and services. Gannett brands include USA TODAY NETWORK with the iconic USA TODAY and more than 100 local media brands, digital marketing services companies ReachLocal and SweetIQ, and U.K. media company Newsquest. To connect with us, visit www.gannett.com.

Do you get excited by daily writing and breaking down problems? Love a well-formed user story and product plan? Are you the type of person who has a passion for products and a writing focus? We’d love to connect with you! We’re looking for a team of product managers to help build our product story through diligent writing and communication.

We’re looking for technical writers who enjoy digging into details and love seeing their words drive action. We’re seeking product managers who enjoy grooming tickets, honing acceptance criteria, thinking through edge cases and planning for the ways a feature might break or be misinterpreted, despite best intentions.

Who will you be working with?

You will join a dynamic, fast-moving team which measures success by product-specific KPIs. You will collaborate closely with internal stakeholders (from newrooms to marketing), external partners and Agile development teams to deliver on an ambitious roadmap and rapidly analyze, test, implement and optimize new and existing features and products. To succeed in this role, you must be a talented technical writer, expert communicator and effective remote collaborator.

What will you be working on?

The USA TODAY NETWORK is a leading local-to-national media & marketing solutions company, whose brands reach 50% of the U.S. digital population, including more Millennials than Buzzfeed. Our mission is to become essential to both consumers and businesses seeking meaningful connections within their communities, whether geographical or cultural. We happen to also own and operate more than 100 local newspapers in 34 states, from the Des Moines Register to the Indianapolis Star .

In This Role, We Will Expect You To
  • Write a high volume of user stories, acceptance criteria and test cases
  • Exhibit strong communication skills in order to deliver clear and concise product requirement documents and broadly communicate your expectations for execution
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to refine requirements and remove impediments for development teams
  • Help groom backlogs, prioritize features, conduct user acceptance testing and evaluate product performance
  • Effectively communicate with remote teams using collaboration software (Zoom, Slack, Jira, Confluence, etc.)
  • Monitor and analyze product performance metrics in partnership with Business Intelligence and other internal stakeholders to improve existing products and identify new opportunities

Qualifications
  • 1-2 years experience product management and/or technical writing
  • Bachelor's degree; Professional Writing Certificate or commensurate experience a plus
  • Able to think critically and constructively about complex business problems, clearly communicating original analyses and presenting solutions that address business needs
  • Experience identifying, analyzing and using data to independently test theories, confirm assumptions and crisply measure and communicate results
  • Curious and open minded, with a knack for synthesizing and prioritizing stakeholder requests
  • Knowledgeable and passionate about human-centered product discovery and design
  • Detail-oriented with excellent organization, analytical and problem-solving skills
  • A highly motivated self-starter who can work effectively across teams and also make things happen on your own
  • Fun to work with and a team player who loves to dig into touch problems

Gannett Co., Inc. is a proud equal opportunity employer committed to a diverse workforce. We will consider all qualified candidates regardless of race, color, national origin, sex, age, marital status, personal appearance, sexual orientation, gender identity, family responsibilities, disability, education, political affiliation or veteran status.

Apply for this position

To apply: https://usr54.dayforcehcm.com/CandidatePortal/en-US/gannett/Posting/View/18734

items.title: Writer: Podcast Show Notes and Blog Posts for Ongoing Retainer
items.content:
Writer: Podcast Show Notes and Blog Posts for Ongoing Retainer

Company: Lower Street Media

Are you a writer with an unhealthy podcast listening habit? You could be just what we're looking for!

We provide you with steady writing work and a proven team-based process that allows you to focus on what you do best.

Transcripts suck. Our writers are more than just note takers. They tease out the themes and lessons from our clients' podcasts and present them in a way that resonates with readers, performs well in SEO, and provides real value to the people they aim to serve.

And no, we're not just talking about show notes. Many of our clients work with us to turn their podcast episodes into long-form blog posts that mean our writers have to get deep into the weeds of the subject matter.

Here's why our writers love being a part of the Lower Street team:

  • Steady, long-term, reliable freelance retainer
  • You get to listen to awesome podcasts every week
  • Our audio editors, managers, and other teammates are here to support you
  • Work from anywhere, any hours (we just care that your weekly deadlines are met)

The most important quality we’re looking for is your ability to write for industries that are relatively unfamiliar to you. You love learning new things and turning interviews into compelling articles. You’ll be able to build your knowledge as you write for niche clients over a long period of time.

You’re comfortable working remotely, with steady, ongoing part-time availability.

If this sounds like you, we'd love to hear from you. Fill out the application form below and we'll be in touch!
How to apply:
Apply here: lowerstreet.typeform.com/to/kBjmaT

items.content:
Part-Time Content Writer

Company: Kayak Advisors
Location: Remote/Online

Job Type: Freelance

Description

Job Title: Part-Time Content Writer

Location: Remote/Online

Kayak Advisors (https://kayakadvisors.com) is seeking a regular writer with experience writing about kayaking and/or kayak fishing, and The website provides reviews and vital advice regarding aquatic sports to readers, and we’re seeking a team member to create content that will suit the needs of a captive and knowledgeable audience.

As a writer, you will receive regular content assignments from the manager and editor, and you will be expected to complete the assignment within the guidelines given. Article topics can vary but may include product reviews, advice posts, “best of” posts, feature articles, and guest posts on various topics. Other projects may be requested as the working relationship grows. Further revisions may be requested after work is submitted for review.

Requirements

  • Native English speaker.
  • The ability to write at least two articles per week. These articles usually are about 1000-2000 words each, but on occasion may require more. More articles may be requested (but would not be mandatory) over time.
  • The ability to implement editor feedback into future writing.
  • Experience writing for online venues and websites.
  • Experience with Kayaking and/or aquatic sports. This includes basic product knowledge, safety procedures, and standard practices.
  • Familiarity with AP style.
  • Can complete standard article requests within three days’ time.
  • Strong research skills.
  • Can take SEO concerns into consideration when writing content.
  • Can keep a consistent line of communication open with managers and editors.
  • Familiarity with Google Docs, Google Sheets, and Microsoft Word.

Additional Preferences

  • A degree in English or closely related field.
  • Previous experience writing with WordPress.
  • Knowledge of how to tailor content so that it can maintain a strong social media presence.

What We Provide

  • Compensation will be .05-.07 cents per word, with potential changes made for non-standard projects.
  • Tools and training necessary for the success of your writing and content for Kayak Advisors

Please Do the Following When Submitting Your Application:

  • In your application please put the word “aquatic” at the top. Applications that do not follow this step will be disregarded.
  • Please include three samples of your work. If possible, send samples as closely as closely related as possible to the content that Kayak Advisors publishes.
  • Answer the following:
  1. What types of writing have you done in the past? What skill sets do you have that make you think you would be a perfect fit for Kayak Advisors?
  2. What is your experience with kayaking and aquatic sports? What is your experience writing about these topics?
  3. What is your availability to work?
  4. What separates your writing from the rest?
  5. Is there anything else you’d like us to know about you?
  • Submit any other information or documents that you think will be helpful in reviewing your application.
  • Send your application to [email protected]

Note:

We will own the exclusive rights to any content, it must not be shared, published or appear anywhere else either in print or online without our expressed permission.

Application Instructions

Send your application to [email protected]

items.title: Associate Editor, NBA
items.content:
Associate Editor, NBA at Bleacher Report

Remote

Editorial | Remote – Work From Home | Full Time and Temporary

JOB DESCRIPTION

About us:

Bleacher Report is a leading digital media source for sports content and conversation. Its NBA coverage is a major driver of reader engagement with our B/R app. We cover the biggest names, news and trends in the NBA while also offering targeted content for fans of every team. Follow the action at bleacherreport.com.

About the role:

  • This is a temporary, full-time position from mid-August to mid-October, 2018. We are looking for an enthusiastic NBA expert with experience assigning, editing or writing NBA text content.
  • The Associate Editor will work with Bleacher Report’s full Editorial team, as well as its Programming and Quality Control departments, to plan, assign, track and distribute NBA content.
  • The Associate Editor will assign topics to writers, develop story ideas and review published content. This is not a writing position.
  • This position can be worked from a Remote location.

Responsibilities include but are not limited to:

  • Tracking NBA news.
  • Developing story ideas.
  • Communicating with writers, other editors and programmers.
  • Monitoring the progress and distribution of text articles.
  • Working five eight-hour shifts per week.
  • Meeting with other NBA stakeholders at Bleacher Report.

About you:

  • 2+ years experience creating or organizing sports text content.
  • Strong communication skills.
  • Organized, detail-oriented.
  • Ability to work in a team environment.
  • 2+ years experience with digital-media production or distribution.
Apply for job

items.content:
Growth Content Writer at Nectafy

Remote | Freelance

Location: TELECOMMUTE United States

Description: Do you know that sickening feeling when you read some of what passes for industry-standard content marketing these days? Yeah, we hate it, too. And you’ve got a chance to blow it out of the water. As a Nectafy contract writer, you’ll help our clients find their unique perspective and create easy-to-understand, world-class content that our clients’ prospects find helpful and insightful. If that seems like a thrilling challenge (and working with a fully-remote-but-connected team sounds like it’d be right up your alley), you might just be the perfect fit for our writer position.

What You’ll Experience:

  • You’ll conduct subject matter expert interviews via video conference, with an eye toward turning the information into clear, informative content offerings.
  • You’ll write helpful & insightful content based on those interviews, plus a little of your own research from time to time, just to keep things spicy.
  • You’ll get to collaborate with our highly motivated remote team in order to help our clients succeed. (And we’re pretty fun to work with, if we do say so ourselves.)
  • You’ll be able to speak honestly about your engagement and how we should improve as a company. (Nectafy is an office-politics-free environment.)
  • You won’t be micromanaged or office-sat.
  • You’ll have the opportunity to improve your writing skills with world-class editing, and you’ll be a part of a team of writers who are excited to do the same.
  • And you get to do it all with a smile.

Responsibilities:

  • Learn the ins and outs of our clients’ industries through research and interviews.
  • Build rapport, trust, and a strong relationship with each client.
  • Understand and implement the principles of the Nectafy Way.
  • Write and publish content assignments to make sure everything is implemented on time, every time, within the budgeted goal.
  • Write and publish content for each client that’s effective and engaging.
  • Understand and implement the principles of content and inbound marketing.
  • Adhere to company and client style guidelines. (Nectafy uses AP style with a few exceptions.)
  • Collaborate with a small teamconsisting of an account lead, a writer, an editor, a designer, and a developer on each client accountto produce outstanding content.
  • Participate in a monthly writers’ discussion and share ideas about how to make Nectafy even better.

About Nectafy:

  • We’re out there. As a completely remote growth content agency, Nectafy is on the front edge of redefining how a company works, interacts, and delivers amazing results to their clients. We like to think of ourselves as pioneers… without the covered wagons.
  • We’re curious. We love to learn and and we’re always up for a challenge. Every day is full of new opportunities. Like remembering which team member is in which time zone. (We’re in all four U.S. time zones and one time zone in Europe.)
  • We’re fun, doggone it. We’re a fun-loving team that knows how to get stuff done. You haven’t lived until you’ve created homemade confetti and thrown it in the air while celebrating a team success!

What We Value: Do you value what we value?

  • Long-term solutions not quick fixes.
  • Intentional learning not complacency.
  • Radical excellence not industry standards.
  • Personal leadership not passive reliance.
  • Team success not personal status.

Requirements:

  • A love of writing. (Because you’ll be doing a lot of it.)
  • Excellent written communication skills, including impeccable grammar, punctuation, and spelling.
  • The proven ability to write strong copy and communicate complex ideas simply.
  • Solid interviewing skills.
  • A passion for details.
  • The motivation to produce a high-quality final product.
  • The ability to provide and receive respectful critique.
  • 2+ years of writing and/or editing experience. (Or you’re just so good that we wouldn’t notice your lack of experience.)
  • Fun to be around! (At least virtually.)
  • Fully committed to Nectafy’s success.

Benefits:

  • Compensation is $160 per standard blog post (600-800 words)
  • Additional content types at per piece rates
Apply for job

items.title: Freelance Creative Writer
items.content:
Freelance Creative Writer

Writing
Anywhere - must be a US resident
Pay to be determined on a per page basis
Company: Danconia Media
Freelance

Overview

Remote Freelance Creative Writer Position

Overview:

Looking to hire creative remote freelance writer(s) to produce unique high-quality content with a wide and diverse subject base.  Position requires producing content for both technical and creative topics. The writer is responsible for all necessary research required to create content that exhibits depth and understanding of the topic matter. Workload has lots of flexibility, and as long as deadlines are consistently met your work schedule can be too!

Job Requirements:

–      Wicked Self-motivated / Go-getter –      Extreme attention to detail – take pride in what you do! –      Successfully adapt to cover a wide array of subject matters –      Efficiently perform required research –      Advanced grasp of the English language, and an eye for editing your own work for grammatical and spelling errors. –      Consistency in the caliber of documents submitted –      At least 2-3 years of professional writing experience –      A curious mind – willing to learn about and understand the intricacies of many different businesses across multiple industries. –      Ability to consistently meet deadlines, even better if you submit content early!









Job Details:

–      This is a 100% remote position, you can travel the world and write for us but you must be a US Resident and have consistent access to Wi-Fi –      There will be a flat rate paid per page of content produced –      Must submit writing samples to be considered for this position –      Pay rate per page will be determined based on experience level and your writing sample. –      Each document will need to be between 500-750 words long –      Content will be written based off of a provided topic –      Writer is responsible for ALL research required to write kickass meaty content. –      A plus if able to write for BOTH non-technical & technical clients








About Danconia:

Danconia is a web design & marketing company that prides itself on solving organization challenges our clients experience. It was founded by businesspeople with decades of experience in sales and marketing, so we understand what it takes to build successful sales-driven organizations both online and off. We strive to be the best in everything that we do and to solve problems that have been deemed unsolvable by other businesses in our industry.


Our employees are as unique as the clients we serve and we wouldn’t have it any other way! Each member of our team brings their own personality, expertise, and overall badassery to our company, and their commitment to their trade is what sets us apart. We used to live that 9 to 5 office life, but have made the change, and become remote friendly, and have never looked back! We believe the best performance is achieved when our employees are working to live rather than living to work, and we encourage individuality and creativity whenever possible. A few of us are still in NH rocking the office or home offices, some of us have thrown in the towel on the New England winters and have moved to the gorgeous mountains of TN, and others travel across the world living that nomadic lifestyle gaining invaluable worldly experience. Regardless of where we are located, we are all collaborating daily to create epic customer stories of success through creative web design and development, SEO, and specialized marketing programs. We are looking for wicked awesome writers to join our team! If you think you might be a good fit and want to be the master of your own destiny, reach out to us; you might just be the next member of our happy growing family.

To apply for this job please visit the following URL: http://dturcotte@danconia.com, aadams@danconia.com →

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=2, go=3, nodejs=3, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=4, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=3}
items.content:
Technical Documentation Writer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior
Industry: Banking, blockchain, Financial Technology
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private
Company: Radix DLT | Stoke-on-Trent, UK

Remote details

Employer's note: 3 months located with our CTO, Dan, in Stoke, England. After this period, you may locate anywhere
Relocation Assistance: Yes

Technologies

javascript
java

Job description

As a Technical Documentation Writer, you will work closely with our global team to create and maintain content that enables our users to do amazing things with Radix. You will work with product managers, developers, quality engineers, developer advocates, technical support, and marketing to create content that not only provides useful information but also serves to enhance the overall user experience.

Your main responsibilities are:

  • Interview project team members, subject matter experts, customers, and product support to determine required technical and user information.
  • From planning to delivery, you will work with stakeholders to plan and document new features/APIs. You will be responsible for creating appropriate content in the form of concepts and architecture guides, developer guides, code samples, language references, API references, and other online material such as training videos.
  • Translate technical and complex concepts into concise and comprehensive instructions and explanations.
  • Create graphics and diagrams that help novice and expert users understand complex technical concepts.
  • Review and edit documents written by other staff and work with non-writers on ways to improve their writing skills and contributions to documentation.
  • Work independently with minimal supervision.
  • Implementation, consistent delivery, and on-going improvement of live and virtual training programs.
  • Work closely with the support and implementation teams to identify areas of improvement in product training and documentation.
  • Research and write documentation that is technically accurate, consistent, appropriate for the audience, and consistent with our writing style.
  • Create product style sheets and style guides to ensure consistency between multiple authors and products.
  • Make customer-requested changes/edits to existing documentation, as appropriate.

Prior experience with startups and working with agile, cross-functional teams is a plus. In-depth knowledge about DLT or blockchain technology is not required, but candidates should generally be interested in the technologies poised to transform the way we live and be open to learning deeply about blockchain topics.

Must have:

  • A minimum of 3 years of technical writing experience on enterprise infrastructure software technologies, preferably with a database or data management software development focus.
  • Experience with multimedia with a proven ability to translate complex software processes into an easy to understand multimedia format such as infographics or short videos.
  • Able to read/write/execute basic sample code written in one or more of the following programming languages: Java, Javascript, Python.
  • General knowledge of SEO and marketing analytics best practices.
  • Have done and like to do demonstrably hard things
  • Opinions on what technologies and standards we should use now and in the future, we always want to hear new ideas.
  • Interest in DLT/Blockchain Technologies.

Bonus:

  • Working knowledge of HTML or JavaScript.
  • Knowledge of DLT/blockchain technology such as decentralization and cryptographic protocols.
  • Knowledge and experience with a relational/NoSQL database
  • Knowledge of git, branching, continuous integration and modern development pipelines.
  • Strong visual and aesthetic sense.
  • Great interpersonal skills and a willingness to go above and beyond when collaborating with the rest of the team.
Apply now

About Radix DLT

Radix is a speedy, scalable alternative to Blockchains and DAGs platforms. It is the first open, public crypto network that can securely scale without centralising, solving the problems faced by everyone from Bitcoin to IOTA.

To learn a bit more about Radix, please watch these videos!

Radix Technology: https://youtu.be/dnOO2nItiss

Radix Target Market: https://youtu.be/FB4qKdKZMLM

Radix Mission: https://youtu.be/Hw90aMyvLbM

You will be joining Radix at the early stages on its life, within the first 20 hires. As such, you will have a fast-paced and exciting journey ahead.

About the Technology:

  1. Introduction to Radix & Blockchain Scaling Issues: https://youtu.be/sW8nWeUnkK0
  2. DAG Scaling Issues & Aims of Radix: https://youtu.be/36DRDd8mh0o
  3. The Basic Components of the Radix Ledger: https://youtu.be/HkOAqdgG6q4
  4. Creating Relative Order of Events on the Radix Ledger: https://youtu.be/wfsZuN6NaJo
  5. Preventing Nodes Lying About the Order of Events: https://youtu.be/jTYGOuS2xvg
  6. Updates About New Events Via Gossip: https://youtu.be/9kPyyOIn6Bo
  7. Creating Node IDs & Basic Sybil Prevention: https://youtu.be/EOisSoQ9Oa4
  8. Radix Security Model: https://youtu.be/7xc9TNKMNLY?t=36m38s

Benefits

  • Remote Working
  • Competitive Salary

items.content:
Freelance writer rate + site credits + various perks
Minimum 3-month commitment & min. 1 feature per month

Location: Anywhere in the known universe with an internet connection OR from our offices in LA, Mexico City, or York, UK

Who we are: Always now, forever independent

Film Daily is an online platform connecting audiences with indie filmmakers via news, views, and reviews.

Our publication is growing quickly and we’re looking for a team of talented freelance scribes to write about the ever-expanding world of indie film, filmmaking, film festivals, and content streaming.

Our target audience is Gen Z, Gen X, and Millennials. We aim to keep our audience entertained about entertainment.

We foster a culture of communication, community, teamwork, and collaboration. Join us now!
Person specification

We need streaming savvy content writers to join our team. You’ll love indie film and peak/cinematic TV and keep up to date with entertainment news. You’ll be able to write quickly, accurately and legally and know how to pitch an editor.

• Film & TV obsessive
• You know your Kurosawa from your Kubrick, your Lynch from your Leigh, your Girls from your Broad City.
• High achiever
• You (think you) understand the way the film & TV industries works.
• You know how to use web searches to learn new skills.
• Dedicated lifelong learner
• Looking for a new challenge
• Willing to do whatever it takes to achieve results
• Able to prioritize your workload
• You think change in Hollywood is long overdue.
• Impressive portfolio of published articles
• Desire to work as a journalist or editor
• Understanding of the way online publications work
• Tenacious
• You know A LOT about film and TV.
• Words are just about your favorite thing.
• You live on the internet.
• You can take a complicated story and cut it down to 280 characters.
What we can offer

• Access to stream endless films & TV
• Paid rates per article
• Full credit/author page
• As few or as many hours as you’d like
The Gig

• Film Daily is looking for the voices of your generation
• We need contributors for our hungry website
• Must have some social media and Wordpress experience
Skills

• Writing
• Tweeting
• Self-editing

Find out what a day in the life of a Film Daily content writer looks like: https://filmdaily.co/obsessions/film-daily-content-warrior/

items.title: Experienced Content Writers Wanted: Versatile Writers for eCommerce and Blogs
items.content:
Experienced Content Writers Wanted: Versatile Writers for eCommerce and Blogs

Company: eZdia Inc
Location: Home Based
Job Type: Contract

Description

Do you have a solid work ethic? Do you stick to deadlines? Do you enjoy writing copy for blogs and eCommerce websites? If you answered “yes” to these questions, we’d love to hear from you.

CrewMachine is looking for experienced writers to create high-level copy for some of the biggest eCommerce companies around. We have a range of ongoing projects in immediate need of solid writers, including product content, blogs, and buying guides. If your application is successful, you could be working on anything from product descriptions and landing pages to buying guides and blurbs relating to tech, fashion, home goods, hardware tools, office supplies, and more.  

The application process is simple, but rigorous. We are looking for the best to join our team.

We need contributors who:

  • Are native to USA, CA, AU, or UK with English as their first language
  • Can produce compelling and flawless copy
  • Are familiar with SEO
  • Can follow instructions

Are you a writer with an unhealthy podcast listening habit? You could be just what we're looking for!

We provide you with steady writing work and a proven team-based process that allows you to focus on what you do best.

Transcripts suck. Our writers are more than just note takers. They tease out the themes and lessons from our clients' podcasts and present them in a way that resonates with readers, performs well in SEO, and provides real value to the people they aim to serve.

And no, we're not just talking about show notes. Many of our clients work with us to turn their podcast episodes into long-form blog posts that mean our writers have to get deep into the weeds of the subject matter.

Here's why our writers love being a part of the Lower Street team:

items.content:
Technical Coach


Thinkful


Technical Coach (Design) 
Remote · Part Time or Full Time


Founded in 2012, Bloc was the first online coding bootcamp. Today, Bloc offers aspiring career-changers programs in software development and design. Bloc offers you an opportunity to join a tight-knit team pursuing a worthy goal: the training, guidance, and support of those who are working towards to new careers as developers and designers. Job Description 
Bloc’s mission is to help individuals pursue their craft and improve their lives. As a Technical Coach at Bloc, you will directly help students develop mastery and support them on their journey to become software developers and designers by helping them solve their day-to-day problems and questions. Responsibilities


* Respond to technical questions and guidance requests that come to the Technical Coaching team

* Adhere to the established Service-Level Agreement to ensure students are receiving responses in the defined timely manner

* Maintain the required quality in assisting students with technical questions and guidance

* Adhere to processes implement by the Technical Coaching team 

* Provide strategic feedback to the Technical Coaching Lead to improve the experience for students and optimize the processes of the team

* Ensure communication with students and others always exemplifies Bloc’s core values

* As necessary, work with Grading Team Lead and other Grading Team Members

* As necessary, interact with mentors, Student Success, or students ad-hoc




Requirements


* Must have at least 6 months of professional industry experience OR have completed one of Bloc’s Developer Track programs OR have completed Bloc's Design Track Program successfully

* Must have significant industry-level experience with: front-end web technologies (HTML/CSS/Javascript/Git) and UX/UI Design or User Research using one of the following tools: Sketch, InVision, Figma 

* Strong written communication skills

* Patient and empathetic

* High level of detail orientation and an exceptional work ethic 

* Must thrive working autonomously 

* Genuinely excited about helping students who are taking charge of their own education and striving for better careers

* Developed sense of empathy and understanding (Learning can be a challenge!)

* Must be coachable and adaptable to a fast-paced work environment

* Must have a reliable, high-speed Internet connection

* Eligible to work in the United States (Bloc does not currently sponsor visas)

* Must reside in one of the following states: Alabama, California, Colorado, Connecticut, Florida, Georgia, Idaho, Illinois, Indiana, Kentucky, Maryland, Massachusetts, Michigan, Minnesota, Missouri, New Hampshire, New York, North Carolina, Ohio, Oregon, Pennsylvania, Tennessee, Texas, Utah, Washington, Wisconsin






Terms of Employment


* This role will last for a period of 3 months; continuation depends on performance and mutual interest.

* Remote .

* Flexible full-time or part-time roles available, with the option to work evenings and weekends when Bloc students are active.  10 hours per week minimum.

* Full-time roles are eligible for medical, dental, and vision benefits.


See more jobs at Thinkful

We’re over 1600 strong across the globe. We’re scientists, strategists, creatives, and innovators. We value individual brilliance and build a strong foundation for Teamwork across all our business. We love the challenge of our industry. We’re changing lives and redefining success every step of the way.

You are dynamic. You are curious. You are more than your job. For you, excellence isn’t just a word; it’s the measure for all you do. You’re passionate. Driven. Dedicated. You can’t stand mediocrity. And you might be the team member we’re looking for.

Job Description
Are you a skilled writer, ready to document SOPs and provide key information to clinical teams? Bring your wordsmithing excitement to PSI as a Technical Writer.

USA: Remote Position

The scope of responsibilities will include:

  • Responsible for creating, reviewing, and/or editing, SOPs, work instructions, templates/forms etc. to provide clear and correct guidance for clinical research processes and procedures
  • Interview and confer with SMEs in cross functional groups develop and/or revise documentation content for completeness and consistency with the processes covered
  • Standardize or make editorial changes to SOPs, Work Instructions, Templates/Forms, prepared by SMEs or other Company personnel
  • Use Microsoft Word for editing and/or creating documents demonstrating proficiency with templates and custom formats
  • Ensure verbiage is easy for comprehension across a population where English is not always the first language
  • Review established documentation and recommend revisions or changes in format or technical language
  • Provide direction with the use of best practices for documentation hierarchy during documentation creation process
  • Maintain records and files of work and revisions
  • Manage the documentation, change order, and change control processes of the procedures as this applies to the scope of responsibilities assigned/activities delegated
  • Develop specific goals and plans to prioritize, organize, and accomplish objectives

Qualifications:

  • FDA regulated Manufacturing and/or Quality experience is a plus
  • A Bachelor’s Degree is required, preferably with an educational background in science, engineering, manufacturing.
  • Minimum 5 years of experience technical writing and/or procedure development, preferably in FDA regulated environment

Additional Information
All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Apply for job

items.content:
PHP Developer for Technical Content

Anywhere in the US
Company: Twilio

FULL-TIME

Overview

Because you belong at Twilio

The Who, What, Where and Why

Who?

You are a developer. You know how magical code can be when it works and how frustrating it feels when it doesn’t. You enjoy sharing that knowledge with others and you do so with patience and empathy.

You are a storyteller and enjoy helping developers write their own stories about the code they’ve written. You enjoy crafting a narrative with a beginning, middle, and end in the blog posts, emails and documentation that you write. And you enjoy making the code the star of the story so developers can learn how to build what you’ve built.

You care deeply about developers. Your interactions online are grounded in empathy, and you generally prefer to praise in public and criticize in private.

What?

You will review and refactor code and content created by contributors from our community as well as write your own code and technical tutorials that serve as examples for Voices authors.

Your work will involve publishing blog posts and videos that help developers learn how to become better technical writers and identifying trends which shape our content strategy. You’ll write and deploy software to give our small team more leverage, and to make sure that developers reading our blog have the best possible experience.

We’ll measure the results of our work by the number “ah-ha, it worked!” moments that developers have when reading the content we’ve helped others to write.

Why?

Twilio’s mission is to fuel the future of communications.

The Developer Network is the team at Twilio whose mission is to catalyze the network of developers who will build the future of communications. The DevNet is comprised of four teams that work closely with one another: the Developer Evangelists, the Developer Educators, the Community Developers and the Developer Voices team. Together, these four teams introduce developers to Twilio and then strengthen the relationships between us.

Twilio is a company committed to your growth, your learning, your development and your entire employee experience. We only win when our employees succeed and we’re dedicated to helping you develop your strengths. We have a cultural foundation built on diversity, inclusion and innovation and we want you and your ideas to thrive at Twilio.

Where?

This is a remote position, based in a major metro area within the US. While working remote, you will still enjoy our incredible perks: a free Kindle when you build your Twilio app, monthly Kindle book reimbursement, monthly gym reimbursement, unlimited PTO, bi-weekly All Hands and more. What you will also get to experience is a company that believes in small teams for maximum impact; that strives to balance work and home life, that understands that this is a marathon, not a sprint; that continuously and purposefully builds an inclusive culture where everyone is able to do and be the best version of themselves. We seek people who naturally demonstrate our , who are challenged by problems, empower others to thrive, people who can draw the owl and not be beholden to one playbook.

Apply for job

items.content:
Consultant, Radio Content Development at Mercy Corps

Remote | International

Category: Programming

Location: Anywhere, Remote

Background: Mercy Corps is a leading global organization that works in 40 countries around the world to alleviate suffering, poverty and oppression by helping people build secure, productive and just communities. Since 2012, Mercy Corps has worked to tackle Nigeria’s complex and evolving needs through a range of dynamic, multi-sector programs. In Northeast Nigeria, Mercy Corps is addressing the immediate humanitarian needs of vulnerable communities; enabling conflict-affected populations to transform from relief to resilience using market-driven approaches; and supporting community-led peace building efforts.

Purpose / Project Description: As the impact of on-going hostilities has diminished in many areas of the Northeast, there is a window of opportunity to communicate to would-be defectors of Non- State Armed Groups (NSAG) complicit in the conflict that there are avenues to safely and peacefully reintegrate into communities. Equally as important is disseminating messaging around de-radicalization, rehabilitation and reintegration (DRR) programs to host communities to promote the acceptance of amnestied returning ex-combatants. Radio is king in the Lake Chad Basin region, an area comprising roughly 1.5 million square kilometers (approximately one third the size of the United States). High illiteracy rates, lack of infrastructure, extreme levels of poverty and an absence of mass communication technology that can reach target audiences in their native language, makes the development and use of radio to disseminate accurate and consistent information critical. Mercy Corps, through funding from the United States Department of State, is currently implementing the Using the Airwaves for Stability in the Lake Chad Basin (UAS LCB) Program. The program seeks to produce and air news, current affairs and special content programming on radio station(s) operating in the Lake Chad Basin to increase understanding of, and support for, the de-radicalization, rehabilitation and reintegration of ex-combatants. This program will result in reduced support for violence, and greater openness to reintegrating returning ex-combatants into communities.

Consultant Objectives: Mercy Corps Nigeria is seeking a radio content developer to develop context-specific DRR content for radio broadcasts over a 5-month period from August 2018 through December 2018 (with the potential for a 1-year extension through 2019). Mercy Corps is currently collaborating with researchers from UCLA and Yale University to conduct a study on the most effective types of messaging used in DRR radio programming, and the results of this study will help inform the content to be developed. In order to have the greatest impact, radio content in both Hausa and Kanuri language will be required.

Consultant Activities: The Consultant will develop radio content in Hausa and Kanuri to:

  • Inform listeners of the existence of DRR strategies through regular news, current affairs and special programing content, including interviews with Nigerian policymakers, government officials, religious and community leaders
  • Profile the experiences of ex-combatants from non-state armed groups who have successfully left the on-going conflict, will include in-depth interviews
  • Provide debate and discussion programs to allow community members to express their views and experiences with conflict and violence, as well as their thoughts on the DRR process
  • Encourage discussion on the drivers of conflict in the Lake Chad Basin, including poor governance, identity-based marginalization, and weak rule of law on radio news, current affairs and special content programs
  • Create an alternative narrative using Kanuri history and culture that delegitimizes non-state armed group messaging around alignment of values, will include Kanuri text readings and interviews with Kanuri community leaders

Consultant Deliverables: The Consultant will:

  • Develop a radio broadcast strategy and calendar detailing the radio content to be broadcast over a 5-month period from August through December 2018 (with the potential for a 1-year extension)
  • Create storyboards and synopses for the to-be-developed radio content for Mercy Corps’ review and approval. Revise storyboards to incorporate Mercy Corps’ feedback.
  • Based on the storyboards and synopses:
    • Create radio content in Hausa and Kanuri to inform listeners of the existence of DRR strategies, including through 90 interviews with Nigerian policymakers, government officials, religious and community leaders
    • Create radio content in Hausa and Kanuri that profiles the experiences of ex-combatants who have successfully left the ongoing conflict, includes at least 12 in-depth interviews
    • Create radio content in Hausa and Kanuri to encourage discussion on the drivers of conflict in the Lake Chad Basin, including weak rule of law, poor governance, and identity-based marginalization, including through at least 96 in-depth interviews with academics and experts
    • Create radio content in Hausa and Kanuri to create an alternative narrative using Kanuri history and culture that delegitimizes non-state armed group messaging though alignment of values, includes through at least 8 Kanuri text readings and 6 interviews with Kanuri community leaders
  • The created radio content must be in a format that allows for radio station(s) around Nigeria and the Lake Chad Basin to broadcast the content.

Timeframe / Schedule:

  • Radio broadcast strategy and calendar detailing the radio content to be broadcast over a 5-month period from August through December (with the potential for a 1-year extension) Due date: July 20, 2018
  • Storyboards and synopses for to-be-developed radio content for Mercy Corps’ review and approval. Revise storyboards to incorporate Mercy Corps’ feedback. Due date: Initial storyboards and synopses must be provided prior to the first broadcasts, with subsequent storyboards and synopses provided on an ongoing basis through December 2018.
  • Create radio content in Hausa and Kanuri to inform listeners of the existence of DRR strategies, including through 90 interviews with Nigerian policymakers, government officials, religious and community leaders Due date: First broadcast in August 2018 and continuing through December 2018
  • Create radio content in Hausa and Kanuri that profiles the experiences of ex-combatants who have successfully left the ongoing conflict, at least 12 in-depth interviews Due date: First broadcast in August 2018 and continuing through December 2018
  • Create radio content in Hausa and Kanuri to encourage discussion on the drivers of conflict in the Lake Chad Basin, at least 96 in-depth interviews with academics and experts Due date: First broadcast in August 2018 and continuing through December 2018
  • Create radio content in Hausa and Kanuri to create an alternative narrative using Kanuri history and culture that delegitimizes non-state armed group messaging around alignment of values, at least 8 Kanuri text readings and 6 interviews with Kanuri community leaders Due date: First broadcast in August 2018 and continuing through December 2018

Consultant Profile:

  • Highly experienced with 5+ years of content and radio production experience.
  • Excellent writer, storyteller and communicator with extensive experience editing and mixing audio. Documentary or journalism experience is a plus.
  • Experience of living and working overseas is desirable, along with experience of producing editorial content for non-US audiences.
  • Knowledge / experience in community peace building and de-radicalization, rehabilitation and reintegration. Experience working for international NGOs or in civil society is a plus.
  • Knowledge of the issues affecting the Lake Chad Basin.
  • Ability to meet deadlines while working under pressure with tight deadlines.
  • Ability to create or translate content into Hausa and Kanuri.
  • Bachelor’s degree in broadcasting, communications, business or related field.

The Consultant will report to: North East Conflict Programs Manager

The Consultant will work closely with: TSU, Program Desk Officers, UAS-LCB Senior Program Officer

Apply for job

items.title: High-Paid Writers for a Business Review Site
items.content:
High-Paid Writers for a Business Review Site

Company: Websmith Inc
Location: Anywhere

Job Type: Freelance

Description

Job Description:  Our blog is a no-nonsense, straight-talking, and honest business review site that focuses primarily on home-based business opportunities.

You'll be responsible for evaluating and writing objective reviews about various MLM companies, franchises, and other similar businesses. The ideal candidate will have some knowledge or personal experience in a network marketing company or home-based business.

The articles need to be heavily researched, factually accurate, and written in a casual and engaging style. The objective of the blog is to give thorough and unbiased reviews on these companies, with zero tolerance given for scams, pyramid schemes, or any type of unethical behavior.

Article Length:   2500 - 3000 words

Requirements:

  • You love to write
  • You’re a grammar nazi, perfectionist, and a good editor
  • You’re able to do deep research on a subject and willing to obsessively fact-check
  • You can grasp complex concepts and make them understandable
  • You have a sense of humor and enjoy writing in a loose, fun and conversational style

Don’t Apply If:

  • You’re lazy or unmotivated
  • You’re just looking for a quick one off job
  • You’re brand new to writing/blogging
  • You’re mostly used to writing quick short posts
  • You’re not willing to spend a significant amount of time researching & getting to know a subject
  • You lack creativity, a sense of humor and/or personality in your writing

To Apply:

Please fill out our writer application HERE.

Once your form is submitted, we’ll get back to you if we think you’re a good fit. Due to the high volume of applications we receive, only suitable candidates will be contacted.

Pay:  We understand that you get what you pay for in life, and are only looking for talented and high-level writers. Therefore, we are willing to pay anywhere from $0.15 - $0.20/word, depending on experience.

Other:

This is NOT a short term position. In fact, we're looking for writers that can grow with the site and stick around for the long term. Other opportunities may follow.

Remote

As a Technical Coach at Bloc, you will directly help students develop mastery and support them on their journey to become software developers and designers by helping them solve their day-to-day problems and questions.

Responsibilities

  • Respond to technical questions and guidance requests that come to the Technical Coaching team
  • Adhere to the established Service-Level Agreement to ensure students are receiving responses in the defined timely manner
  • Maintain the required quality in assisting students with technical questions and guidance
  • Adhere to processes implement by the Technical Coaching team 
  • Provide strategic feedback to the Technical Coaching Lead to improve the experience for students and optimize the processes of the team
  • Ensure communication with students and others always exemplifies Bloc’s core values
  • As necessary, work with Grading Team Lead and other Grading Team Members
  • As necessary, interact with mentors, Student Success, or students ad-hoc

Requirements

  • Must have at least 6 months of professional industry experience OR have completed one of Bloc’s Developer Track programs OR have completed Bloc's Design Track Program successfully
  • (Developer Track Technical Coaches) Must have significant industry-level experience with at least 3 of the following: HTML/CSS/Javascript/Git, Node, React, Rails, AngularJS, Open Source Contributions, Databases/SQL/Algorithms/Data Structures
  • (Design Track Technical Coaches) Must have significant industry-level experience with: front-end web technologies (HTML/CSS/Javascript/Git) and UX/UI Design or User Research using one of the following tools: Sketch, InVision, Figma 
  • Strong written communication skills
  • Patient and empathetic
  • High level of detail orientation and an exceptional work ethic 
  • Must thrive working autonomously 
  • Genuinely excited about helping students who are taking charge of their own education and striving for better careers
  • Developed sense of empathy and understanding (Learning can be a challenge!)
  • Must be coachable and adaptable to a fast-paced work environment
  • Must have a reliable, high-speed Internet connection
  • Eligible to work in the United States (Bloc does not currently sponsor visas)
  • Must reside in one of the following states: Alabama, California, Colorado, Connecticut, Florida, Georgia, Idaho, Illinois, Indiana, Kentucky, Maryland, Massachusetts, Michigan, Minnesota, Missouri, New Hampshire, New York, North Carolina, Ohio, Oregon, Pennsylvania, Tennessee, Texas, Utah, Washington, Wisconsin

Terms of Employment

  • This role will last for a period of 3 months; continuation depends on performance and mutual interest.
  • Remote .
  • Flexible full-time or part-time roles available, with the option to work evenings and weekends when Bloc students are active.  10 hours per week minimum.
  • Full-time roles are eligible for medical, dental, and vision benefits.

Apply now
