items.title: Associate Editor
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=2, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
Associate Editor

Worldwide
Company: Growth Machine

PART-TIME

Overview

Growth Machine is expanding quickly, and we need your help to produce the best content on the Internet.

We’re hiring a part time associate editor (with the potential to move to full-time) to assist with the process of producing articles for our clients to ensure they’re error-free, fit the client’s brand, and meet the high standards we set.

As one of the first employees of the company, you’d work directly with our Managing Editor, Heather, and our Director of Content Strategy (Nora) to strengthen the systems that allow us to grow blogs to hundreds of thousands of monthly visitors.

Your responsibilities

  • Editing articles we produce for clients to make sure they’re error-free and fit their voice.
  • Working with a team of writers to provide feedback and help them improve their craft.
  • Working with Heather and Nora to improve our editorial and publishing systems.
  • Having the final say for when content is ready to go live on as many as a dozen different popular blogs.

Who you are

  • You’re a meticulous editor who errs on the side of more feedback, not less.
  • You’re punctual—deadlines are not options for you.
  • You’re a confident writer.
  • You have a systems-first approach to work, focusing on designing and perfecting repeatable methods instead of just completing tasks.
  • You’re great at working independently, setting your own goals and hitting them.
  • It’s a bonus (but not mandatory) if you’ve successfully grown your own or a company blog, and have some experience managing other content producers.

Benefits of working with us

  • We’re a 100% remote company, so you can work anywhere from Pittsburgh to Phuket.
  • By editing and publishing content for anywhere from five to a dozen blogs, you’ll improve your writing and marketing skills faster than you can anywhere else.
  • You’ll get to edit content from a wide variety of categories, including artificial intelligence, travel, sales, HR, and more as we expand our client base.
  • We share all client results internally, so you’ll get to see hundreds of thousands of people reading the work you helped produce.
  • We’re growing rapidly, and you’ll have ample opportunities for taking on bigger roles.
Apply for job

items.title: Be part of the writer's community who are helping travelers and hotels around the world
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Be part of the writer’s community who are helping travelers and hotels around the world

Company: Arrivedo
Location: Anywhere

Job Type: Freelance

Description

We want to change the way everyone travels. We want travelers to experience the best local insights every time and make the most out of their trip. This is your chance to help us change that.

Arrivedo works with a community of more than 1600 international freelance writers, (including, but not limited to) travel-oriented bloggers, authors, literature and creative writing students who create Neighborhood Guides for hotels all over the world. We currently host over 650 Neighborhood Guides for hotels in more than 120 cities around the globe, providing our services to renowned international chains like JW Marriott, Waldorf-Astoria, Four Seasons, Westin Hotels & Resorts, Ritz-Carlton, as well as B&Bs, hostels and boutique hotels in remote locations around the globe.

What does the Arrivedo Writers Community do?
Help travelers with local recommendations you share in a hotel’s Neighborhood Guides.


How do THEY do it?
1st: Outreach to hotels: Approach hotels via email or in person offering to set up their writer’s profile in Arrivedo. (We provide support, resources, and incentives to help you)

2nd: Gather hotels local recommendations: Interview hotel staff to collect the hotel’s local recommendations and insights into their neighborhood.
3th: Create a Neighborhood Guide: Use Arrivedo’s editor to create 8-10 short articles showcasing the hotel’s local recommendations from themes ranging from routes, gastronomy, nightlife, cultural activities, essential tips and more. Here is an example Neighborhood Guide from Hotel Majestic in Chicago: https://arrivedo.com/dest/en/chicago/hotel/the-majestic-hotel-3.

 

Why do THEY do it?
With Arrivedo you have the chance to go beyond and help travelers to experience the world in a different way with your written word. You have the opportunity to share and learn about other cultures. The unique community of Arrivedo Writers helps you with the best tips on how to communicate your ideas, outreach and even get to know others around the globe.

 

What are the benefits?

  • Getting certified as one of Arrivedo’s 1600 international travel writers.
  • Be part of our private network of Arrivedo Writers.
  • Being able to sell your writing services to any hotel in the world. Arrivedo does not take a commission from your deals with hotels. Transactions are 1-on-1 in between writers and hotels.
  • Improve your Sales skills. We assign you a coach to help you on the outreaching process and provide you with all needed material.
  • Be aware that hotels prefer to pay with free accommodation (normally 3 nights), but you can negotiate a monetary payment.

items.content:
Freelance Blog Writer

Company: The HOTH
Location: Tampa Bay

Job Type: Freelance

Description

Hey. We’re the HOTH.

No, it’s not a Star Wars reference. But points for noticing. It stands for Hittem’ Over the Head - in other words, to bludgeon with awesomeness.

It can be used as a noun (as in our product, or brand), or as a verb (to HOTH someone or HOTH something). And it’s how our clients refer to one of the world’s top SEO companies.

We run an awesome blog product, and we’re looking for freelance writers who want to gain real-world experience writing content for our clients across all sorts of industries.

Are you business savvy? Do you have a knack for researching niche topics? Do you live and breathe writing and content marketing?

If so, we’d like to chat with you!

Why We’re Awesome to Work With:

  • You’ll fill your portfolio with a variety of professional writing samples
  • We have high quality standards, which means awesome training - you’ll learn a ton
  • Work from wherever you want (as long as we can reach you)
  • There is PLENTY of work to go around, and no cap on what you can write
  • We recognize talent and promote from within
  • Kickass bonuses and incentives
  • Quick, consistent pay

Why We Want to Work With You:

  • You have experience working under tight deadlines
  • You can grasp complex concepts and make them understandable
  • You have excellent grammar and writing skills
  • You understand that great content marketing is informative, conversational and fun
  • You have a sense of humor
  • You love to write

What Our Writers Have to Say About Working at the HOTH:

“Writing for the HOTH allows me the daily flexibility I need, while also offering me the unlimited potential for success. I can write when I want and where I want, and I’ve learned SO much along the way. I’ve sharpened my writing skills, improved my critical thinking, and strengthened my researching abilities. Oh, and the team is awesome to work with, always providing guidance, encouragement, and motivation when I need it the most!”

“Writing for the HOTH has been a pure pleasure so far. I’m learning so much about a variety of topics, having fun, and earning at the same time. The quality control team is friendly and helpful, as is the content manager. As a freelancer, it’s great to know there’s plenty of work to be done and that I will enjoy it, and get paid.

The HOTH consistently pays every week-- and, as someone who has had to chase down overdue payments in the past, that goes a long way! I love everything about writing for the HOTH and look forward to a long-term relationship with the company.”

Interested? Please apply via this link. (2 writing samples are required.)

items.content:
Copywriter

Company: DistantJob
Location: Telecommute
Job Type: Full-time

Description

You’re a writer - and you’ve grown up on Asimov and other science fiction titans. But are you excited about the possibilities of AI, about how they will shape the world within the next ten years? Do you devour any new tidbit about how AI is progressing and helping improve the human experience? Do you always say “please” and “thank you” to Siri… You know, just in case the Robot Overlords take over, and she remembers?

 

We’re looking for someone to write for a client that is committed to teaching people about Data Science, Machine Learning, Blockchain and Artificial Intelligence. They believe these are the most important topics for the decade to come, and they need a passionate and committed writer to work with them full-time to produce the best educational content on this subject matter.

 

Role and Responsibilities:

  • Create top-class copy for Landing Pages and Email Marketing (Newsletters and Campaigns).
  • Proofread all promotional assets (Lead Magnets, Webinar Presentations, Social Media
  • Posts, Video Scripts, etc.)
  • Set a Voice and Tone identity for the businesses (Copywriting Guidelines).

 

Desired Qualifications:

  • English Native Speaker (and Writer).
  • Ability to write engaging copy that makes readers smile.
  • Self-motivated, with excellent verbal communication skills.
  • Being passionate about success and curious about learning new things.
  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic and ever-changing environment.
  • Committed to resourcefulness -- in times of uncertainty, creatively “making it work” and finding new ways to produce results.
  • Extra points given for knowledge in Data Science.

 

What’s In It For You:

 

  • Remote work. Say goodbye to commutes, office space, pants.
  • Full-time work. No more hunting down freelance clients and juggling multiple receipts.
  • Flexible schedule. Because you never know when the cat will catch on fire.

 

Here’s what you need to include in your application to get the job:

 

  1. Link to one sample of your best writing. One. 1. Uno. If you have trouble deciding, roll the dice. Please send only one.
  2. Propose the outline of an article covering a topic that you would enjoy writing on this (AI / Data Science) subject. A TITLE is not enough. We want to see a Table Of Contents.

items.title: Freelance editor needed for long-term work
items.content:
Freelance editor needed for long-term work

Company: Team Polaris
Location: Anywhere

Job Type: Freelance

Description

Your job will entail editing casino and sportsbook reviews and articles to make sure that:

  1. The writing is concise (think FAQ or product manual-type voice and tone)
  2. Contains no fluff or humor.
  3. Has a natural, easy-to-understand flow. Subject-verb-object order, simple sentence structures, strong and confident vocabulary.
  4. Contains no flowery language.
  5. Is consistent in terms of tenses

You must be willing to follow our editorial guidelines.

Here's an example of the voice and tone we're going for: 888 casino review.

This file demonstrates the type of writing quality you would be working with on a regular basis. Some writing will be slightly better, some will be slightly worse. The difference won't be significant either way.

Please contact me if you're interested and include a relevant sample (change-track mode) if possible.

items.content:
Technology Writer

Writing
US Eastern Time Zone
Company: Bustle
Part Time

Overview

Bustle Digital Group is seeking a to create affiliate content surround tech-related product roundups. Writers will produce listicles and slideshows featuring products our readers will love, whether it’s a roundup of the the best Bluetooth speakers under $100 or a guide to buying the best portable battery charger.

 Part-Time, Remote Commerce Tech Writer

The goal of this content is to compel readers to purchase the products that are suggested in the articles. The success of an article is measured based on the affiliate revenue it earns — this means a strong candidate needs to not only be a strong writer but be a great product marketer/salesperson.

The ideal candidate should have at least two years of writing experience, ideally in the tech space. Previous commerce or affiliate writing experience, SEO, and sales copy experience is a plus, but not required. Most importantly, candidates should be knowledgeable and passionate about products, especially those found on Amazon!

Candidates must be able to work remotely at least 2 to 4 full days per week, Monday through Friday, during business hours. Please do not apply UNLESS you have this availability — 

we don’t operate on weekend hours, so an ideal candidate is someone who is looking for a part-time role that offers competitive hourly rates.

Examples of Commerce Team Stories:The Best Bluetooth Car Adaptors

https://www.bustle.com/p/the-4-best-bluetooth-car-adaptors-7987318

The Best Bluetooth Speakers Under $50

https://www.bustle.com/p/the-7-best-bluetooth-speakers-under-50-8975799

Responsibilities
  • Research/write affiliate content

    • Requirements
    • Availability to work remotely 2-4 full days per week during business hours, M-F (Do not apply unless you have this availability)
    • 2+ years of editorial or copywriting experience in tech
    • BONUS: Commerce or product copywriting experience

      • Bustle Digital Group is the largest premium publisher reaching millennial women. Every month, nearly 80 million readers turn to Bustle Digital Group publications — Bustle, Romper, Elite Daily, and The Zoe Report — for impactful conversation around the interests and issues engaging women today. Focusing on everything from pop culture to parenthood, Bustle Digital Group’s content leverages the power of a diverse set of voices from coast to coast. Bustle Digital Group does business with over 300 global brands, and ranks among the most popular media companies with our demographic on social media. Bustle Digital Group was founded in 2013 and is headquartered in New York City, with offices in Los Angeles and London.

      To apply for this job please visit the following URL: https://jobs.lever.co/bustle/a5dadb2a-3432-47fd-b6e5-362a1ca71ea0 →

items.title: Content Writer
items.content:
Content Writer at EmoryDay LLC

Remote | Freelance | Part-time

EmoryDay is looking for talented Content Writers who can provide editorial expertise to join our team of freelance digital marketing staff.  In this position you will be working with various team members to create and edit dynamic content that will enhance our EmoryDay’s marketing initiatives.

As a full service Internet marketing company, we provide business marketing services to companies in need of a full service outsourced solution. Our teams meet with our clients regularly to progressively improve and manage all aspects of their Internet marketing, including:

  • Website Design
  • Content Development
  • Lead Generation
  • Search Engine Marketing
  • Newsletters
  • Social Media & Publicity

Skills:

Our ideal candidate has at least 2+ years of copywriting experience for online media or within an agency setting.

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Journalism, English, Advertising, Communications or related field
  • Exceptional writing and editing skills, particularly for web and digital channels
  • Ability to write compelling subject lines, headlines, copy and call to actions
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Demonstrated ability to manage multiple competing priorities under tight deadlines
  • Highly organized with strong attention to details
  • Experience with SEO and a content management system (CMS)
  • Ability to create Keywords and Metatags

Responsibilities:

  • Write, edit and proofread website content
  • Write headlines, promotional copy, editorial content, etc for all wesite updates
  • Write subject lines, headlines, promotional copy and call to actions for digital campaigns such as email campaigns, social media ads, display ads, etc.
  • Incorporate clear, concise and compelling content that meets SEO and digital marketing best practices
  • Can be flexible with tone and voice to suit the audience based on the project at hand
  • QA site, email and digital content to ensure copy, images, hyperlinks, and other assets meet branding guidelines and are fully functional
  • Take ownership of assigned accounts and help lead content development initiatives per the direction of the assigned account manager
  • Be available for the occasional client conference call to discuss content development strategy

Work Environment:

All of our consultants and employees work virtually. The opportunity provides a certain amount of flexibility timing and the number of hours worked. Most of our consultants work from home offices and each provide their own computers to work from.

Compensation:

The compensation for the position is flexible based on experience, availability and number of projects you would like to work on.

Apply for job

Description

LOVE PHOTOGRAPHY?

items.title: Technical Hiring Interviewer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=2, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=2, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Technical Hiring Interviewer

Developer
Anywhere
$100 per interview
Company: Karat
FreelancePart Time

Overview

Karat has reengineered technical hiring to ensure that great talent gets noticed by great companies.   We augment engineering organizations by conducting the first-rounds of technical interviews on their behalf. Our service saves material engineering time and drives a highly responsive and consistent experience for candidates.  Karat continuously invests in cutting edge interview methodologies with an aim of reducing bias and letting candidates demonstrate their true ability.

We operate as strategic partners for engineering leaders at the world’s leading technology companies including Jet, MuleSoft, Roblox, Intuit, Ten-X, Minted and many more.   As the gold standard of technical interviewing, our well-funded company is scaling quickly to meet our growing list of client’s needs.  Come join us!

Join our community of Expert Interviewers.

Karat’s Expert Interviewers are recognized and rewarded for doing a first-class job as top assessors of technical talent. Every interviewer in the network is an accomplished engineer.  Our interviewers include development managers, start-up engineers and freelancers covering the full technology stack.

Flexible, high impact work that is compensated at highly competitive rates.

As an Expert Interviewer, you will be compensated at highly competitive rates for your interviewing expertise.  The time commitment is flexible—many of our interviews happen on nights and weekends.  Some experts do 10 interviews/week (our minimum requirement) while others do over 25 interviews/week.  You can work from anywhere, anytime.  You will sharpen your interviewing skills and transform the interviewing experience for every candidate and company.

Who are we looking for?

We are looking for experienced software engineers who believe that interviewing is a first-class job. You should possess:

  • Interviewing experience focused on evaluating fundamental computer science skills (i.e. data structures, algorithms etc.), software craftsmanship (i.e. understanding of unit testing, source control, APIs etc.), and/or specific technologies (i.e. iOS, distributed systems etc.).
  • Strong oral and written communication skills.
  • Able to empathize with candidates and provide actionable feedback.
  • An ability to structure your schedule (i.e. you can pick certain blocks of time during the day, evenings, weekends).

items.content:
Associate Content Editor

Company: Growth Machine

Growth Machine is expanding quickly, and we need your help to produce the best content on the Internet.
We’re hiring a part time associate editor (with the potential to move to full-time) to assist with the process of producing articles for our clients to ensure they’re error-free, fit the client’s brand, and meet the high standards we set.

As one of the first employees of the company, you’d work directly with our Managing Editor, Heather, and our Director of Content Strategy (Nora) to strengthen the systems that allow us to grow blogs to hundreds of thousands of monthly visitors.

Your responsibilities
  • Editing articles we produce for clients to make sure they’re error-free and fit their voice.
  • Working with a team of writers to provide feedback and help them improve their craft.
  • Working with Heather and Nora to improve our editorial and publishing systems.
  • Having the final say for when content is ready to go live on as many as a dozen different popular blogs.

Who you are
  • You’re a meticulous editor who errs on the side of more feedback, not less.
  • You’re punctual—deadlines are not options for you.
  • You’re a confident writer.
  • You have a systems-first approach to work, focusing on designing and perfecting repeatable methods instead of just completing tasks.
  • You’re great at working independently, setting your own goals and hitting them.
  • It’s a bonus (but not mandatory) if you’ve successfully grown your own or a company blog, and have some experience managing other content producers.

Benefits of working with us
  • We’re a 100% remote company, so you can work anywhere from Pittsburgh to Phuket.
  • By editing and publishing content for anywhere from five to a dozen blogs, you’ll improve your writing and marketing skills faster than you can anywhere else.
  • You’ll get to edit content from a wide variety of categories, including artificial intelligence, travel, sales, HR, and more as we expand our client base.
  • We share all client results internally, so you’ll get to see hundreds of thousands of people reading the work you helped produce.
  • We’re growing rapidly, and you’ll have ample opportunities for taking on bigger roles.
Fill out the form at www.yourgrowthmachine.com/careers/associate-editor

Commerce Technology Writer at Bustle

Remote | Entry-level | Part-time

REMOTE

EDITORIAL BUSTLE

PART-TIME

Bustle Digital Group is seeking a Part-Time, Remote Commerce Tech Writer to create affiliate content surround tech-related product roundups. Writers will produce listicles and slideshows featuring products our readers will love, whether it’s a roundup of the best Bluetooth speakers under $100 or a guide to buying the best portable battery charger.

The goal of this content is to compel readers to purchase the products that are suggested in the articles. The success of an article is measured based on the affiliate revenue it earns this means a strong candidate needs to not only be a strong writer but be a great product marketer/salesperson.

The ideal candidate should have at least two years of writing experience, ideally in the tech space. Previous commerce or affiliate writing experience, SEO, and sales copy experience is a plus, but not required. Most importantly, candidates should be knowledgeable and passionate about products, especially those found on Amazon!

Candidates must be able to work remotely at least 2 to 4 full days per week, Monday through Friday, during business hours. Please do not apply UNLESS you have this availability we don’t operate on weekend hours, so an ideal candidate is someone who is looking for a part-time role that offers competitive hourly rates.

items.title: Content Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=5, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
*Who are we?*

We are Zzish. Education technology’s most passionate pioneers. Our mission is to get the best education apps and resources into the hands of every learner in the world so that they can fulfill their potential. Our talented, enthusiastic team are building and scaling a data-driven, real-time insight and recommendation platform for teachers, parents, districts and government.


*Why Zzish? Why now?*

You’ll be joining Zzish at a pivotal point in our growth. We have 140,000 teachers in 170 countries who love our product and are seeing meaningful results with their students. We have world-class technical leadership and liberty to choose the latest and greatest technology to work with. Most importantly, we have a constantly evolving product roadmap which we believe will change the future of education forever.

The Content Manager at Zzish is an integral part of the team who engages with all departments to ensure product and marketing content engages teachers and students worldwide. You will be translating and breaking down curriculum aligned content into format that can be uploaded to our platforms. We are looking for a creative leader who has a background in education and can independently generate relevant content for our platform and to enhance user engagement. You will need to understand our audiences’ needs in order to inspire teachers and educators, particularly in the United States.


*You will…*

* Research, create and edit interesting and relevant content for: Quizalize (a Zzish platform), weekly blog articles, social media platforms, email marketing
* Resource copyright free curriculum content to develop educational quizzes, translate into a clear format that can easily be coded by our development team
* Manage and engage in the development of educational quiz content that meets our customers’ needs
* Organise and distribute weekly emails to users about product updates, educational topics and events
* Develop a content calendar which coincides with the academic year
* Understand how and when to reach out to teachers and support users effectively
* Gather user research and analyse content use to inform and steer new content ideas
* Ensure that all content is within the style, tone and message that Zzish wants to convey
* Conduct quality control across Zzish platforms to ensure the content is relevant and age appropriate
* Stay up-to-date with education market developments and industry trends
* Produce content inline with our growth plans and business priorities
* Manage and build relationships with internal teams, teachers and freelancers who support in content writing
* Nurture freelancers to produce content, ensuring timelines are met and style and tone are on brand.

*Skills and experience...*

* A background in Education is essential to understand our user base, the school systems and processes
* Strong copywriter and editor, with excellent grasp of English grammar
* Really comfortable disseminating content into excel spreadsheets
* Ability to produce content for social media platforms
* Exposure to a Content Management System (CMS), preferably Wordpress and ideally some experience in HTML
* Familiar with customer engagement tools such as Intercom and Mailchimp
* You will be an accomplished organiser and planner with great communication skills

*You'll get...*
* Competitive salary in line with experience
* Share options: when we achieve our goals these will be worth more than the annual salary
* A Perkbox.com account with discounts for a number of retail and lifestyle companies and salary sacrifice benefits such as our cycle to work scheme.
* Team socials, snacks and Diet Coke
* An impressive network of mentors and investors
* To join and learn from a team of passionate and super talented people
* The chance to use your talent for the social good!

3+ months

EXPERIENCE: intermediate

SKILLS:
• Content Writing
• Copy Editing
• Content Management
• Copywriting

We are looking for a talented copywriter to support our team's interesting variety of projects, promotions, campaigns and communications. The team is mostly designers, and we require copy support to help improve our stakeholder's messaging, correcting spelling & grammar in British English and helping us with ideas for headlines and copy.

The copywriter will work in project teams on projects led by the Senior Designers and Art Director. Sometimes input will be required in the early parts of the project during the brainstorming, and other times only at the end for quality control and consistency of written tone purposes. Content must be error-free and adhere to the company’s style guidelines. An ability to simultaneously work on multiple projects with short deadlines is a must.

The ideal candidate will be comfortable working in a collaborative environment, and must be flexible with quick turnarounds. This person will work remotely and can be based anywhere so long as the hours overlap with the Central European timezones for at least part of the day. Team members are located in Switzerland, The Netherlands, USA, Singapore & Brazil.

On occasion this person will support with getting English content translated into other languages through an external translator.

Working hours are negotiable and there will be regular work. Does this sound like an interesting and suitable role for you?

items.content:
Technical Writer Expert in WordPress

Company: OnTheGoSystems

OnTheGoSystems, established in 2007, is a global company with staff from all over the World. We are the proud authors of the popular WordPress plugins WPML and Toolset.
Our plugins run hundreds of thousands of commercial websites, probably in every language spoken on Earth.

We are looking for an experienced technical writer located in Europe, to join our documentation team. Do you love writing in a way to help people use products and services easily? Do you have a strong background in WordPress? If so, you are the person we are looking for.

What the role involves

As part of our documentation team, you will work closely with our development teams, writing documentation for our plugins and services. This involves learning and documenting the new features, as well as making sure existing documentation stays relevant and up to date. Additionally, you will be in contact with our clients, making sure to always understand their needs and their perspective when using our products.

What is required

  • Excellent English written and oral communication skills
  • Proficient usage of WordPress
  • +2 years experience writing technical documentation in the IT field
  • A voracious attention to detail and meticulous writing and editing skills
  • Excellent research skills
  • Ability to handle large amounts of complex data
Nice to have

  • Experience with producing videos
  • Familiarity with our WPML and/or Toolset plugins
  • Experience working remotely with a distributed team
  • Being familiar with Usability testing
Is this role what you are looking for? 

Apply here: www.onthegosystems.com/jobs/Please, make sure to stand out from the rest, and also send us a few links with some writing samples that you feel very proud of.

items.title: Freelance (Remote) Writer
items.content:
Freelance (Remote) Writer

Company: Wpromote
Location: U.S.

Job Type: Freelance

Description

Here at Wpromote, one of the nation’s leading digital marketing firms, we invite you to “Think Like A Challenger” and push our clients to take on the 800 lb. gorillas of their industries. Our crew of 300+ digital marketers breathes in marketing and exhales ROI, and we challenge our clients and ourselves each and every day to surpass yesterday’s expectations! Our award-winning campaigns have helped hundreds of companies from startups to Fortune 500 brands thrive. If you’ve heard of Marriott, Verizon, Forever 21, TOMS, Wienerschnitzel, or Zenni Optical, you’ve heard of our clients. And we want you to join us in making our clients even better.

We are looking for detail-oriented, efficient, and reliable SEO writers to add to our team!

You Will Be

  • Communicating directly with and taking direction from Wpromote’s SEO and Content Marketing Managers
  • A dedicated writer for a number of Wpromote’s clients; the number of accounts you write for is up to you and what you are comfortable with
  • Writing monthly batches of content for our client(s) that may include blogs, resource pages, category pages, product pages, and other web content. Content will vary in writing style and tone depending on the client
  • Performing research on the client(s) and becoming a brand expert
  • Utilizing SEO best practices in your writing including the body, headings, and titles
  • Adhering to brand guides, matching the writing style of our client(s), and using verbiage that speaks to our target market(s)
  • Performing research on your assigned monthly topics to create unique, quality content
  • Reviewing and proofing your work to ensure your copy is high-quality, clean, and error-free
  • Making edits and revisions as needed

You Must Have

  • Bachelor's degree; English, Writing, or related field preferred
  • Extensive experience writing for different clients/companies
  • Proven experience writing to different target audiences and working with brand guides, and adjusting your writing style as needed
  • Knowledge of SEO best practices and experience writing SEO-optimized copy
  • Solid MS Office skills
  • The ability to be efficient, detail-oriented, and reliable
  • The capacity to answer emails in a prompt manner and occasionally talk on the phone (reminder: This is a remote/freelance position)

Application Instructions

If you feel like you’d be great fit for this role, we’d like to hear from you! Apply by emailing [email protected], and please include the following in your application (failure to do so will result in not being considered for the position):

• “Freelance Writer (Remote)” in the email subject line
• Your résumé
• A bullet point list of industries and topics you're comfortable and confident writing on (e.g., beauty, cybersecurity, IT, health, food, etc.)
• Cover letter explaining why you would be a great addition to our team and what experience you have with SEO writing
• 3-5 relevant writing samples

We’re looking forward to hearing from you!

items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Frontend Developer
Industry: IT Consulting
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Technologies

taxonomymetadataschemacontent-management-systemontology

Job description

Do you love making content intelligent? We are looking for content engineers to help make the world smarter with intelligent content.

[A] seeks motivated candidates with experience in some of the following area. This is a client-facing role and we’re looking for candidates with a mix of experience in some of the following content disciplines:

  • Modeling
  • Metadata
  • Markup
  • Topology
  • Schema
  • Taxonomy

The role will involve work from mostly your home office but may involve occasional travel to a client location.

The Content Engineer will work with our practice to craft intelligent content structure for multi-channel marketing and increase the value of semantically rich content. You will participate in, or lead, client projects surrounding customer experience management and personalization.

You’ll define content structure, metadata, content reuse planning, taxonomy, and other content relationships. This includes syndication strategy, search engine optimization (SEO) factors, semantic web schemas, and implementation planning for the CEM / CMS platforms such as Sitecore, Adobe, Kentico, and Episerver.

What You’ll Be Doing

  • Structuring content through building content models, taxonomies and metadata definitions
  • Leading client discovery onsite, gathering details and organized data about the current state and desired future state
  • Educating clients on the value of intelligent content, workflows around Content Engineering, and related topics meant to build a client’s internal resources and capabilities
  • Bridging the gap for clients between content strategy, the CMS platforms, operations, and other customer experience technologies
  • Collaborate on information architecture and UX prototyping
  • Determine schema strategy and structural rules

Skills We Are Looking For 
Not all listed skills are required for this role. We are looking for somebody who is experienced in some of the following areas.

  • Exceptional writing, facilitation, and communication skills (required)
  • Detail oriented, organized, self-motivated (required)
  • Collaborate well across distributed team (required)
  • Experience with content models, taxonomies, schemas, adaptive content
  • Experience with any/all of the following: marketing software, content management systems (CMS), customer experience management systems (CEM), DITA, SEO, the semantic web
  • Working understanding of the digital publishing stack including HTML5, CSS, JSON and related JavaScript systems



Learn more about [A] at simplea.com.

Apply now

About [A]

[A] is the Content Intelligence Service.

[A] is a distributed, private, professional services firm that provides strategic support for building content intelligence practices into organizations. [A] helps complex organizations establish content engineering standards and practices to compete in a multichannel, multimodal, AI-driven world.

[A] engineers intelligent content systems for CMS/CEM platforms, and offers integration, training, workshops and custom development. [A] helps clients value content as an enterprise asset, and enables future-ready content through use of the Master Content Model.

What’s Your Name, [A]gain?

Our name is easy. Just say “A.” The [A] brackets represent markup, microdata, content intelligence. The letter “[A]” represents the start, initiation, beginning of change. We are going to help change the world with intelligent content.

Cultural Fit at [A]

  • You love learning, you love teaching.
  • You enjoy wearing multiple hats and roles, and titles are not important to you.
  • You do top-quality work, manage quality, and make everything you touch better.
  • You are comfortable working under strict confidentiality agreements and often behind-the-scenes.
  • You are self-organized and manage time and resources well.
  • You work alone well but communicate well within a team.

[A] Team Benefits

Being an [A]gent comes with its benefits. Work from anywhere. Advance your career on the leading-edge of the content and technology sciences. Earn a competitive salary, and for longtime [A]gents, participation in a profit-sharing plan. But many [A]gents find the best part of working as an [A]gent are the other [A]gents you work with and the culture at [A].

We take care of each other and we honor each other's work and contributions to the team. We work to make ourselves better and our [A] team better. We make efforts to adapt new technologies and methodologies that can help us optimize our time, and we expect you to collaborate on these efforts if you’re an expert on any of those fields. We communicate and reach out to other [A] players.  We love learning. We love teaching. We write. We code. We support each other. For the right people, working at [A] feels like coming home. 

Benefits

  • Remote Workforce
  • Competitive salary
  • Shared company performance incentives
  • Individual training budget
  • A well-documented career path
  • Flexible hours & personal independence
  • Other benefits based on location.
  • 401K

items.title: Community Manager
items.content:
Who are Quill?
If you ask Deloitte Fast 50 or Santander Breakthrough50, they’d say we’re one of Britain’s most exciting and disruptive businesses. If you ask our team, they’d say we’re a no-politics, people-first company where exceptionally smart individuals get the chance to have their voice heard and potential fulfilled (then pushed that extra bit more).
And if you ask our clients, they’d say we’re the content production partner they rely on to rapidly create high-quality editorial, video and images to drive online sales. To date, we’ve produced over 40 million words of on-brand content – in 29 languages and counting – for 170+ of the world’s most prestigious brands, including eBay, Farfetch and Google.

We do that through a combination of our unique methodology, our global network of ~2500 screened freelance creatives and Quill Cloud, our content production management tool.

What does being a Community Manager at Quill involve?
In this brand new position, you’ll take a leading role in managing and engaging our global Network of 2,500+ creative and editorial freelancers. You’ll take ownership of innovating and implementing exciting Network-wide programmes, designed to make Quill the company freelancers want to work with. You’ll be responsible for proactively solving Network-focused problems, from individual issues to process flaws, and will set the standard for excellence in communication, both on a one-to-one basis when responding to queries and to the entire Network when launching new initiatives for them to take part in.

These are the skills you’ll need for the job:
Change management skills: can plan and execute the successful implementation of large-scale changes that affect both in-house and remote teams

Leadership: can motivate in-house and freelance colleagues to support on and participate in Network-focused initiatives

Business nous and strategic thinking: can balance understanding of the needs of different elements of the business and develop and execute engagement strategies in line with these needs

Analytic ability and enthusiasm for problem solving: can proactively and consistently analyse ways of working and embrace the opportunity to continually make things better

Empathy paired with pragmatism: can instinctively empathise with others and balance the drive to help with a pragmatic assessment of the circumstances and the needs of all of your stakeholders

Excellent one-to-one communication skills: can take active steps to understand the root of queries or issues and select the appropriate format for their expertly crafted comms – whether one-to-one or at a group level

And here’s the experience you need:
You must have experience of developing an idea from initial concept to successful roll-out, including planning the project, getting buy-in from key stakeholders and managing the implementation process and the associated communications

You must have experience of managing a large team or community, ideally with a number of remote individuals, and motivating them to deliver excellent results

You must have a wealth of experience in handling tricky and sensitive communications – both one-to-one, and at a higher level

Why should I join Quill?
Like most startups, we talk a lot about our culture. But for us, culture isn’t just words on a wall. It’s part of our recruitment process, our personal development plans and our day-to-day.

If any of this sounds like you, you’re looking for a spot on the right team:
Your integrity isn’t for sale. You’re a what you see is what you get type of person who’s honest about their strengths and development areas.

You don’t settle for second best. It really, really matters to you that everything you do is excellent. And you don’t shy away from empowering your colleagues to share those standards.

10 minutes with nothing to do feels like an hour for you. You’re smart, energetic and driven, so you’re at your best when everything’s a little hectic.

You don’t like going through the motions or blindly following instructions. You leap into complex situations that don’t have an easy answer and relish the challenge of coming up with one.

The idea of a fixed ‘remit’ doesn’t appeal to you. Neither does waiting three years to get a promotion you earned two years ago. You think and act beyond your role.

You’re a fundamentally kind, respectful person, searching for a place filled with similarly kind, respectful people.

What are the benefits?
On top of joining the Quill family and all the benefits that come with that, you’ll also get:
25 holiday days per year plus UK bank holidays
A contributory pension
Our Summer Away Day (no stuffy meeting rooms in sight)
Monthly socials and lunches/breakfasts
Fortnightly Inspire Lunches – past lunches have included how the CEO manages his wellbeing, what today’s most disruptive businesses have in common and a crash course in Russian
A significant amount of time, expertise and attention put into your personal development, plus an unusually broad scope for rapid career progression

Quill is an equal opportunities employer.

items.title: Content Writing Pioneer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=3}
items.content:
JOB TYPE: Full time

EXPERIENCE: beginner

COMPANY: 1Password; 50-200 employees; 75-100% remote;

SKILLS:
• Copywriting
• Content Marketing

Over the years, the 1Password blog has been mostly authored by our founders, a few developers, and our head of security Jeff Goldberg. We're expanding that to do a bit more content outreach – we'd like to reach more people online so they can learn how to stay safe while they browse. As a Content Writing Pioneer, you'll colonize the realm, working with the design and security team to write new copy for our blog, product web pages, and other marketing materials.

What you'll do

For the first 6 months as a content writer, you'll be expected to complete the following projects:

Month 1

- Read the 1Password style guide to learn how we communicate to our customers.
- Work with the design team to write copy for new features on 1Password.com.
- Refine existing content so it's consistent with our style guide and keywords. And make sure Matt's typos are fixed before it's updated.

Month 3

- Build relationships with the press through new releases and other announcements, and work with them to keep articles they've written accurate and up to date.
- Collaborate with other blogs on our existing blog posts so they can publish them.
- Draft press releases for new features, releases, and other 1Password news.
- Work with the security team to write articles about 1Password's security, educate our customers, and reach potential ones.

Month 6

- Continue creating new content for 1Password.com, press releases, blog posts, and other content you've been working on so far.
- Help improve traffic to landing pages on 1Password.com, working with the sales team on what potential customers are looking for in a password manager.
- Monitor popular keywords in online security and keep the ones on our blog and landing pages up to date.
- Try new things: We're a flat organization so you have the freedom to experiment with the ideas you've compiled in your little notebook up to this point.

What you have

- Communication skills that get people to understand, not just skim, what you're writing.
- A way of adapting those communication skills to new audiences with different styles and tones.
- Familiarity with keywords placement, meta descriptions, alt text, and your other favorite SEO buzzwords.
- A knack for learning things on your own and quickly adapting to new environments. Since 1Password is remote, it’s important to be independent in your research, but also have the humility to ask for help when you aren't sure about something.
- An inner compass that knows its way around Google Analytics.

What you also might have

- A year or so of experience writing copy, blog posts, and other content for an app or product you love.
- An acquaintence with Markdown, HTML, CSS, and perhaps Hugo.
- Personal experience with 1Password.

Sounding like your cup of tea? Tell us your favorite tea.

items.title: [Remote] Community Manager
items.content:
JOB TYPE: Full time

EXPERIENCE: intermediate

COMPANY: Selfkey Foundation; 75-100 employees; 75-100% remote;

SKILLS:
• Community Management
• Social Media Marketing

SelfKey is a blockchain-based, self-sovereign identity system that allows individuals and companies to truly own, control and manage their digital identity. In today’s world, your digital identity details are stored across thousands of servers in various places where you’ve registered an account. Ongoing large-scale hacks of stolen data in recent years have shown that big centralized stores of information pose serious security concerns.

During recent ICO, Selfkey reached the 'Public Sale Max Cap' in 11 minutes, raising $22M in the public sale. Built on open-source technology, our products power various market and business use cases, such that; enable users to instantly and securely obtain citizenship and residency by investment, access hundreds of FinTech products and services, incorporate companies, open bank accounts, authorize to trade on exchange platforms, manage cryptocurrency portfolios & receive/send/store ETH (or any ERC-20 token), and more.

We believe the future of identity management lies in utilizing blockchain technology because it’s decentralized, immutable, and protected by cryptography. You’ll be able to take full ownership of your personal data and identity, while sharing only the necessary information with other individuals or organizations. When it comes to crypto exchanges, financial products, and token sales - this can remove the often complex, repetitive, and redundant process of KYC/AML (Know Your Customer / Anti-Money Laundering). SelfKey makes this process simple, painless, and easy - we’ve been mentioned here, here, and here.

Required Skills:
· Create content that promotes audience interaction
· Moderate all user-generated content
· Propose new ideas and concepts for social media content
· Collaborate with Marketing and Product teams to create social ‘buzz’ regarding new product launches
· Market Research
· Capture and analyze the appropriate social data/metrics, insights and best practices
· Collaborate with the marketing manager and internal teams on marketing strategy
· Provide administrative support to the marketing team
· Analyze questionnaires and other forms of feedback
- Manage our communities on Reddit, Twitter and Telegram
- Schedule & create relevant content to share on social media
- Daily posting & responding to messages on required Social Media channels

Preferred Skills:
· Previous experience as a Community Manager managing groups of several thousand members
· Interest & basic knowledge of the Crypto & Blockchain space
· Video creation and editing skills (non essential but beneficial)
- Experience managing & growing a YouTube channel (non essential but beneficial)
- Social Media management experience
-Occasional work on weekends may be required to cover certain social channels
- Experience using Canva, Buffer and any other relevant social media tools

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Digital Media
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Technologies

ruby-on-rails

Job description

Location: Remote within the US or Oakland, CA

We are seeking an Applications Architect who will lead a small team of developers to evolve the Content Applications (publishing, authoring, commenting, image library) from primarily a monolithic Rails application to a services-oriented architecture. This person will work closely with the System Architect of the Services team to realize the organization's goals.

Daily Kos is a great place to work-- your code will be used by hundreds of thousands of people a day who care deeply about progressive politics and are working to effect real political change. We provide an extensive feature set that extends from blogging to activism and beyond. If you want a job that offers more than just a technical challenge, we'd love to hear from you. Our organization’s commitment to personal growth reduces churn and encourages a rewarding long-term position. We have an energized team filled with great people with different backgrounds.

Qualifications:

  • We are seeking an independent, remote-work experienced technical leader who:
  • can weigh tradeoffs of different application design decisions given requirements with team and organizational risk in mind and articulate this to Product Management to help them make informed choices (also have an appreciation for system architecture);
  • can articulate the difference between CRUD-based and Event-based system architectures and their relative tradeoffs;
  • has recent experience with growing the skills of a small development team as a mentor or people manager (must be interested in managing 3-6 developers);
  • has on-call experience for applications they have delivered to production;
  • has production experience maintaining, and evolving a Rails "majestic" monolith into a service-oriented design.

The above list is a set of highly desired attributes; we will evaluate each candidate as a whole. Tell us about unique skills, experiences, and attributes that you can bring to such a role that we may be missing and why it would be a benefit to the organization.

Apply now

About Daily Kos (Kos Media LLC)

Daily Kos is the nation's largest liberal online political community, news organization, and activism hub. Powered by millions of dedicated activists, we’re transforming media and organizing by empowering regular Americans to reshape politics.

Daily Kos offers competitive salary, excellent benefits including generous time off along with paid maternity/paternity/family leave, employer ­paid medical insurance for employees, and a flexible work environment. You need to pick up your kids from school? No problem. You like to work out in the middle of the day? No problem. The office is conveniently located in Oakland, CA, close to BART. People love working here, and tend to stay for a long time. We have a great space filled with great people, and the atmosphere is energized by the day's news events and our common cause.

At Daily Kos, we believe that the diversity of ideas, experiences, and cultures that our employees contribute to our organization help us be more effective activists, and we are proud to be an inclusive and equal­ opportunity workplace. We're a company that loves learning and supports growth and training for all our employees. This position will be located remotely or in our Oakland, CA office.

Benefits

  • 100% Medical Coverage
  • 6 weeks paid vacation per year
  • 401K Plan

Job description

[A] is looking for an account lead with a strong base of exposure to content technologies, to join our team in the role of a Content Technology Account Director.  

As a Content Technology Account Director, you will be involved with building and maintaining relationships, consulting on business challenges, writing and presenting proposals, closing deals, and ensuring the growth and development of our strategic delivery team.  To succeed in this role, you will need a thorough understanding of the obstacles and challenges our clients face at the intersection of business, content, and technology. Your value lies not only in your consultative sales experience but also in your strong technical aptitude and understanding of content technology solutions.  Familiarity with CMS, CCMS, CEM, DAM, CDP, CSP, PIM, CRM, and other such related enterprise systems across techcomms and marcomms will provide the best foundation for rapid success in the role.

This is a remote role that can be done from anywhere in North America.

What you’ll be doing:

  • Drive new business within current accounts.
  • Generate new business and continually advance the sales pipeline.
  • Work with a heavy lead flow, in collaboration with other stakeholders, to qualify new opportunities.
  • Assist with pipeline dynamics.
  • Consult with clients at a detailed level about their content-related technical challenges.
  • Serve as a subject matter expert on content technology solutions.
  • Partner with internal subject matter experts, when necessary, to work through solutions.
  • Architect, present and implement proposals, statements of work, and strategic account plans.
  • Provide clean account transition to delivery and remain involved while delivery onboards and until all production rhythms are running at full steam.
  • Manage trimester account reviews, and account planning rhythms.
  • Cross-train, and potentially lead, other account Content Technology Account Directors as [A] grows.

You may be a good match for this role if you have...

  • 6+ years experience selling in an enterprise environment
  • Experience with and deep exposure to content technology
  • Exposure to technical communications and marketing communications groups
  • Technical expertise with CMS and CEM platforms like:
    • Sitecore
    • Kentico
    • Adobe AEM
    • Episerver
    • Liferay
    • Drupal / Acquia / Wordpress
  • Exposure to DAM and CSPs like:
    • Nuxeo
    • Alfresco
    • OpenText
    • Widen
  • Proven ability to meet and exceed revenue targets
  • Experience managing and growing a sales pipeline
  • Experience in consultative/solution selling environments
  • Experience selling at the executive level
  • A considerable amount of self-motivation
  • Passion for excellence in customer service
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English
  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience
  • A strong cultural fit with [A]’s values.

Cultural Fit at [A]

  • You love learning, you love teaching.
  • You are constantly growing your own knowledge, and helping to grow the knowledge of others.
  • You enjoy wearing multiple hats and roles, and titles are not important to you.
  • You do top-quality work, manage quality, and make everything you touch better.
  • You are comfortable working under strict confidentiality agreements and often behind-the-scenes.
  • You are self-organized and manage time and resources well.
  • You are able to not only work alone, but also communicate within a team by sending updates, tracking time, and other forms of communication while you work.

Learn more about [A] at simplea.com.

If this sounds like you, then write up a cover letter letting [A] know why you want to work at [A], what you do best, and what inspires you.  A great cover letter will say much more than the resume (though we'd like to see that too).

Apply now

About [A]

What is [A]?

[A] is the Content Intelligence Service, and we work with clients to create a Content Intelligence System. The Content Intelligence System is a holistic set of people, processes, and tools that maximize content-ROI by ensuring content is coherent, self-aware, and quantum.  By creating a Content Intelligence System, we increase the effectiveness and ROI of the content assets while reducing overall costs.  [A] works holistically to build all aspects of a content intelligence system in partnership with clients and agencies. This includes not just the technology architecture and implementation, but enabling companies with the organizational muscles to drive content intelligence.


[A] Team Benefits:

Being an [A]gent comes with its benefits. Work from anywhere. Advance your career on the leading edge of the content and technology sciences. Earn a competitive salary and for longtime [A]gents, participation in a profit-sharing plan. But many [A]gents find the best part of working as an [A]gent are the other [A]gents you work with and the culture at [A].

We take care of each other and we honor each other's work and contributions to the team. We work to make ourselves better and our [A] team better. We make efforts to adapt new technologies and methodologies that can help us optimize our time, and we expect you to collaborate on these efforts if you’re an expert on any of those fields. We communicate and reach out to other [A] players.  We love learning. We love teaching. We write. We code. We support each other. For the right people, working at [A] feels like coming home.

Benefits

  • Remote Workforce
  • Competitive salary
  • Shared company performance incentives
  • Individual training budget
  • A well-documented career path
  • Flexible hours & personal independence
  • Other benefits based on location.
  • 401K

items.content:
REMOTE- Cerner Report Writer - Jobmote

REMOTE- Cerner Report Writer

In-Time Infotech Inc.

Position: REMOTE-Cerner Report Writer
Location: NJ-New Jersey/Bridgeton
Duration: 6+months

Interview Mode-Phone and Skype
Needs USC or GC or EAD-GC Only
REMOTE POSITION

JOB DESCRIPTION

This is a remote position - Must work East Coast hours

They are converting from DA to DA2 (Discern Analytics 2.0) and need a resource to come in and do all of the reporting for the conversion.

Monitoring status of reports that are assigned to them to build, and then reporting to management on status of reporting build in general. - DA, DA2, PowerInsight, CCL

  • Background experience with CCL Reporting

  • Experience with PowerInsight reporting

  • Experience working with Charge

  • Experience with Data Extraction and Report Writing

  • Strong verbal and organizational communication skills

  • Previous experience working with Cerner

  • Bachelor's degree or related work experience

Discern Analytics 2.0 (DA2).

DA2 is a newer Cerner's product, similar to SAP BusinessObjects and built on the Eclipse Platform. With DA2 you can design, view and schedule reports. There is a semantic layer to define subject areas (domains), dimensions and measures. It is no SAP BusinessObjects, but I found it really powerful, flexible and feature rich. Strangely enough I do not really know anyone using DA2.

Like PowerInsight, it is a handy tool to pinpoint location of data in Cerner Millennium database - DA2 comes with ready to use domains and a set of dimensions and measures. You can simply drop them to a new document and generate actual database query. Last time I checked though, DA2 had only a few subject domains and Revenue Cycle domain was the most complete one.

Regards

Waqar Ateeq

(Technical resource Specialist)

In-Time Infotech Inc

..............time matters

39962 Cedar Blvd., Ste 185, Newark, CA 94

Phone : x 330

Direct :

Fax :

items.title: SimpleTexting: Copywriter and Marketer for Mobile Marketing Software as a Service Company
items.content:
Copywriter and Marketer for Mobile Marketing Software as a Service Company

Posted May 24

SimpleTexting
Headquarters: Miami, FL
https://simpletexting.com/
View all SimpleTexting jobs →

SimpleTexting is seeking an entry-level copywriter and marketer to help with company messaging, marketing, and copywriting.

This is a remote full-time contract position and requires a disciplined and motivated individual.

Responsibilities:

  • Research the marketplace to help optimize the way we communicate our offering at several first touch points (e.g., the way we tell our story on our homepage)
  • Work with senior management to modify first-touch messaging based on research.
  • Write new copy for the company product site.
  • Work with our SEO agency to determine content gaps and write copy to fill them.
  • Research long-form site article ideas and present to management for writing approval.
  • Research short-form blog article ideas and present to management for writing approval.
  • Anything else we think you would succeed at and would help the company.

Qualifications:

  • Creativity, intelligence, and affinity for a good turn of phrase.
  • Experience with marketing or sales copy is ideal.

The perfect match is an articulate individual with an interest in internet technology and marketing. You will have the opportunity to collaborate with excellent professionals, internally and externally. This is your opportunity to see how a distributed team of professionals works to build, support, and advance a software as a service platform.

Apply for this position

Send an email to jobs@simpletexting.net with a few non-boilerplate sentences about yourself and why you're the right person for this opportunity. Include a one-page PDF resume along with a writing sample and/or a link to your portfolio.Include 3-5 questions that you’d like to ask us after reviewing our website and this job ad.Include the phrase “I like guacamole” in the subject line of your email.
